Eq. 261, cf. Antipho 3.2.1; αὐτουργοί τε καὶ ἀ. Pl. R. 565a; ἀ. καὶ οὐ φιλόδικος D. 40.32; ἀκάκους καὶ ἀ. Id. 47.82; οἱ ἀ. οὐκ ἄδικοι Arist. Rh. 1381a25; τὸν μηδὲν τῶνδε [τῶν πολιτικῶν] μετέχοντα οὐκ ἀπράγμονα ἀλλʼ ἀχρεῖον νομίζομεν Th. 2.40; πόλις ἀ. keeping clear of foreign politics, Id. 6.18; ἡσυχία ἀ. Id. 1.70; βίος ἀνδρὸς ἰδιώτου ἀπράγμονος Pl. R. 620c; τὸ ἄ. Th. 2.63; τόπος ἀ. a place free from law and strife, Ar. Av. 44; ἀπόλαυσις ἀ. X. Mem. 2.1.33. Adv. -μόνως without trouble or care, E. Fr. 787; ἀ. ζῆν ἡδύ Apollod.Com. 1.1.

data.quote: πολυπράγμων, ὅστις δὲ πράσσει πολλά . . μωρὸς παρὸν ζῆν ἡδέως ἀπράγμονα
ἄν τινʼ αὐτῶν γνῷς ἀπράγμονʼ ὄντα καὶ κεχηνότα
τὸν μηδὲν τῶνδε [τῶν πολιτικῶν] μετέχοντα οὐκ ἀπράγμονα ἀλλʼ ἀχρεῖον νομίζομεν

children.label: II
children.definition: not troublesome or painful, τελευτὴν . . ἀπραγμονεστάτην τοῖς φίλοις X. Ap. 7. Adv. -μόνως without trouble, Th. 4.61, X. HG 6.4.27; σῴζεσθαι Th. 6.87; ὁ λόγος ἀ. εἴρηται carelessly, Arist. Mete. 369b27: Comp. -έστερον X. Ages. 4.1.
simple, ἐσθής Muson. Ep. 4.
Castle of Indolence, Sans-souci, as Augustus called his retreat on an island near Capri, Suet. Aug. 98.
Sm. Jd. 9.4.
do nothing, to be idle, Arist. EN 1095b33; opp. πράττειν, Id. Pol. 1325a31.
gain nothing, παρά τινος X. Cyr. 1.6.6.
waste oneʼs time, Lyd. Mag. 1.22.
lose power, of a drug, Paul.Aeg.3.4.

definition: ἄπρακτος, Ion. ἄπρηκτος, ον, Pi. I. 8(7).7 codd.:

children.label: I
children.definition: Act., unavailing, unprofitable, ἄπρηκτον πόλεμον Il. 2.121; ἀπρήκτους ἔριδας ib. 376; ἄ. ἐλπίς Simon. 5.16, cf. Pi. l.c.; ἄ. γίγνεταί τι D. 9.40; ἄ. ἡμέραι days when no business is done, holidays, Plu. Aet.Gr. 2.270a, cf. BGU 255.8 (vi A. D.); restful, παῦλα B. 9.8; ἄ. ἑορτή Proll.Hermog. in Rh. 4.15 W.(s. v.l.); ἀ. χρόνος period of inaction, Plb. 2.31.10.

children.label: b
children.definition: untilled, Lys. 7.6.

unsuccessful, ἄπρηκτος νέεσθαι Il. 14.221; ἄ. ἀπιέναι, ἀπελθεῖν, ἀποχωρεῖν, Th. 4.61, 99, 1.111; ἄ. γίγνεσθαι gain nothing, Id. 2.59; ἄ. ἀποπέμπειν τινά Id. 1.24: Comp., Socr. Ep. 6.7. Adv. -τως unsuccessfully, Th. 6.48; ἄπρακτʼ ὀδυρόμενον in vain, B. Fr. 8.
not taking part in the action, ἄ. κηδευτὴς ὁ χορός Arist. Pr. 922b26; doing nothing, idle, Ti.Locr. 104e, Arr. Epict. 1.10.7. Adv. ἀεργῶς καὶ ἀ. PFlor. 295.5 (vi A. D.).
impotent, μόρια Orib. Fr. 67, cf. Dsc. 3.101. Adv. -τως, βοηθεῖ οὐκ ἀ. Orib. Fr. 129.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., against which nothing can be done, unmanageable, incurable, ὀδύναι, ἀνίη, Od. 2.79, 12.223; μεληδόνες Simon. 39; φόβων -ότατος καὶ ἀπορώτατος ὁ τῆς δεισιδαιμονίας Plu. Superst. 2.165d.

data.quote: φόβων -ότατος καὶ ἀπορώτατος ὁ τῆς δεισιδαιμονίας

children.definition: not to be done, impossible, πρᾶγμα, ἔργμα, Thgn. 1075, 1031; ἄπρηκτα impossibilities, Id. 461.
not done, left undone, X. Mem. 2.1.2, D. 19.278; ἄ. ποιῆσαί τι undo it, Id. Prooem. 41.
κοὐδὲ μαντικῆς ἄ. ὑμῖν εἰμί not unassailed even by your divining arts, S. Ant. 1035.
non-action, τὸ μέλλον ἴσον ἀπραξίᾳ λέγω intending to act is the same as not-acting, E. Or. 426; οὐδεμίαν . . πρᾶξιν οὐδʼ ἀπραξίαν Pl. Sph. 262c.
rest from business, leisure, Men. 633: in pl., = Lat. justitium, Plu. Sull. 8.

children.label: II
children.definition: want of success, κοινὴ ἀ. Aeschin. 1.188.
futilities, Phld. Rh. 1.38S.
want of purchasers, no sale, Eup. 62, D. 27.21, 34.8.
on, unsold, unsaleable, dub. in Lys. 7.6, cf. D. 34.9, BGU 18.4 (ii A. D.), al.; unprostituted, Aeschin. 2.23. Adv. ἀπρατί Sch. Il. 1.99.
unseemliness, Pl. R. 465b, etc.
impropriety in writing, Id. Phdr. 274b.

children.label: II
children.definition: ugliness, εἴδεος ἀπρεπίη APl. 16.319, cf. Dsc. Alex. 27.

unseemly, unbecoming, ἀ. τι ἐπιγνῶναι, πάσχειν, Th. 3.57, 67; ἀ. καὶ ἄσχημον Pl. Lg. 788b; μέθη . . φύλαξιν -έστατον Id. R. 398e; τὸ . . τοιαυτὶ ποιεῖν ἀπρεπές Epicr. 11.33; τὸ ἀ., = ἀπρέπεια, Th. 5.46, 6.11. Adv. -πῶς, poet. -πέως, h.Merc. 272, Pl. Phdr. 274b, etc.: Comp. -έστερον Hdn. 3.13.1.

children.label: II
children.definition: disreputable, indecent, ἀνδρίον Theoc. 5.40.
implacable, AP 7.287 ( Antip.), Nonn. D. 28.1, al.

definition: ἀπριάτην [ᾰ] ( ἀπριάδην read by Rhian. in Hom.), Adv. of πρίασθαι,

children.definition: without purchase-money, ἔνθα με . . ἐκομίσσατο Φείδων ἥρως ἀ. (speaking of a man) Od. 14.317; so in late Prose ἥδετο ἀ. εὐωχούμενος Agath. 4.22:—also as fem. of Adj. ἀπρίατος, μή με ἀπριάτην περάσαντες (sc. Δημήτερα) h.Cer. 132; δόμεναι . . κούρην ἀπριάτην ἀνάποινον Il. 1.99: acc. pl., ἀπριάτας Pi. Fr. 169.7.
on, struck unceasingly, prob. l. for ἄπριγκτοι πληκτά in A. Ch. 425 (lyr., Blomfield).

fast, tight, ἀ. ὄνυξι συλλαβών S. Aj. 310; ἀ. ἔχεσθαι τοῦ κερδαίνειν Id. Fr. 328, cf. Theoc. 15.68, Luc. Nec. 5, Eun. VS p.475 B.; τοῖν χεροῖν λαβέσθαι τινός Pl. Tht. 155e, cf. Plb. 12.11.6; ἔχειν χείρεσσι Theoc. 24.55; δράξασθαι AP 5.247 ( Paul.Sil.).

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst., a kind of ἄκανθα (Cypr.), EM 132.53.
not to be sawed, μοχλός Aen.Tact. 20.2.
unsawed, Q.S. 12.137, prob. in CPHerm. 28.11 (iii A. D.).
without the use of the trepan, Hp. VC 14; not trephined, ib. 20.
inconsistency, Hp. Ep. 17; prob. in Sammelb. 4317.5 (ii/iii A. D.), for τῆς σῆς σαπροεραισει.
without set purpose, not deliberate, of actions, Arist. EN 1135b10, Arr. Epict. 2.16.1, Plot. 1.2.5, etc. Adv. -τως Hp. Prog. 2, Arist. EN 1106a3, Phld. Ir. p.93 W., etc.
incapable of choice or purpose, Hermog. Id. 2.4; not under the control of will, Phld. D. 3 Fr. 75, M.Ant. 6.41, al.
on, making no progress, of persons, Phld. Ir. p.43 W.

children.label: II
children.definition: not advancing matters, inconclusive, λόγος Id. Sign. 6 and 35.
unprotected, Pall. in Hp.Fract. 12.285 C.
failure to look forward, Phld. Herc. 1251.7.
unpremeditated, Arist. EN 1135b11; λόγοι Thphr. Char. 3.1; not deliberated upon, D.H. 4.72, J. BJ 3.5.6.
not submitted to the βουλή, D. 22.5, Hyp. Fr. 231, Plu. Sol. 19; of the Roman Senate, App. BC 1.59.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., without forethought or premeditation, Arist. EN 1151a3, Ceb. 8. Adv. -τως Pl. Lg. 867a, 867b; ἀ. τοῦ ἀποκτεῖναι without purpose of . ., ib. 866e.
want of premeditation, Pl. Lg. 867b.
Adv. -λως rashly, A. Ch. 620 (lyr.).
not promulgated, Hyp. Fr. 231.
without preface, Tz. Proll.Hes. 10.
without preliminary trial, [ δίκα] GDI 5017 ( Gortyn).
without president, ἐκκλησία Eun. Hist. p.209D.
not fixed to any definite time, opp. ἐμπρόθεσμος, Sor. 1.33.
undesignedly, Plb. 9.12.6.
want of readiness, Suid. s.v. ἀρρωστία.
unready, backward, Hdt. 7.220, Th. 4.86, X. An. 6.2.7, etc. Adv. -μως Pl. Lg. 665e.
unforeseen, Nic. Th. 2, 18, AP 7.213 ( Arch.), 9.111 ( Id.). Adv. -ῶς Archig. ap. Orib. 8.2.19.
Act., unforeseeing, prob. in Nonn. D. 9.102, 48.757.
without portion or dowry, ἄ. τὴν ἀδελφὴν διδόναι Is. 3.29, cf. D. 40.20; λαβεῖν Lys. 19.15, Diod.Com. 3.4, cf. Men. Mon. 371.
not proceeding or emanating (cf. ἀπρόοδος), Dam. Pr. 34; θερμή Gal. 14.729. Adv. -τως Hsch.
undisguised. Adv. -πτως Chio Ep. 7.3, 13.3.
not elaborately prepared, D.H. Is. 14.
lack of progress, Sch. Luc. Bis Acc. 21.
making no progress, Man. 3.375, Ptol. Tetr. 156.
without discussion, admittedly, POxy. 1467.22 (iii A. D.).
= Lat. sine praejudicio, Just. Nov. 17.8.
unanticipated, Stoic. 3.149, Onos. 8.1.
not prejudged, τὸ ἀ. τῶν πράξεων Hierocl. in CA 24p.459M.
unprejudiced, Syrian. in Metaph. 1.15.
want of forethought, Pl. La. 197b, J. BJ 3.5.6.
ἀπρομήθητος. Adv. -τως Suid. s.v. ἀφειδῶς.
not known beforehand, τὸ ἀ. τῶν γεγονότων J. AJ 19.3.1; τὸ ἀ. failure to take previous account in time, ib. 18.6.5.
unforeseen, A. Supp. 357.
improvidence, Epicur. Fr. 368, Alex.Aphr. de An. 178.22, Procl. in Prm. p.746S.
to be imprudent, Sch. Il. 4.2.
unpremeditated, ἀκρασία Arist. MM 1203a30; χώρα ἀ. an unguarded country, Plb. 4.5.5; τόποι ἀ. unreconnoitred, Id. 3.48.4; not the work of providence, κόσμος Ph. 2.411, cf. Hierocl. in CA 11p.442M.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., not considering beforehand, ἡ ὀργὴ -τον X. HG 5.3.7; ἀ. καὶ ἀπαράσκευοι Plb. 5.7.2, cf. Orph. Fr. 233; ἀ. τῶν ἐσομένων J. Vit. 13; τῶν ἐπὶ γῆς πραγμάτων Luc. Bis Acc. 2, etc.; of the gods, not exercising providence, Epicur. Fr. 368. Adv. -τως X. Cyr. 1.4.21, etc.; ἀ. τινὸς ἔχειν Str. 2.5.1; opp. προνοίᾳ, S.E. P. 1.151; οἱ ἀ. θεώμενοι without previous acquaintance, Plb. 10.14.8.

definition: ἀπρονόμευτος οὐ πρυτανευθείς· ἀπρονομή (sic) γὰρ ἡ ἐπὶ τῆς χώρας ἁρπαγή, Hsch.

children.definition: without πρόξενος, A. Supp. 239.
burning bush, Dictamnus albus, Pythag. ap. Plin. HN 24.158.
not proceeding or emanating, ἡ [τοῦ ἑνὸς] φύσις Dam. Pr. 34.
without preface, Luc. Hist.Conscr. 23, Corn. Rh. p.358 H. Adv. -τως D.H. Lys. 17.
unforeseen, A. Pr. 1074 (lyr.); ἐξ-όπτου Aesop. 330. Adv. -τως PAmh. 2.154.7 (vi A. D.).

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., not foreseeing, unwary, Poll. 1.179; ἀ. τοῦ μέλλοντος Id. 3.117. Adv. -τως Sor. 1.71, Ael. NA 1.8.

definition: ἀπροόρατος, ον, = foreg. [ἀπρόοπτος] I, D.S. 20.96, Corn. ND 10, Iamb. Protr. 21.

children.definition: not previously seen, Gal. 14.279.

children.label: II
children.definition: = foreg. [ἀπρόοπτος] ΙΙ, Ph. 2.268, Max.Tyr. 11.6; τοῦ μέλλοντος Ph. 2.159. Adv. -τως Onos. 22.1, D.L. 9.62, Ach.Tat. 2.6, Max.Tyr. 31.1.
freedom from precipitancy, Ti.Locr. 102e.
freedom from precipitancy, deliberateness, Stoic. 2.39, Chrysipp. ib. 40, M.Ant. 3.9.
not precipitate, Chrysipp.Stoic. 2.40; συγκατάθεσις Arr. Epict. 2.8.29, cf. M.Ant. 4.49. Adv. -τως Chrysipp.Stoic. 3.50.
not foretold, Pl. Lg. 968e, as Ast for ἀπόρρητος.
without appellation, Proll.Hermog. in Rh. 4.21 W.
not befitting, τινί Eust. 1271.58.
detached, ζῷον ἤδη ἀ. Theol.Ar. 46.
not accosted, Plu. Aud.poet. 2.29b, Fac.lun. 921f; unapproachable, Aristocl. ap. Eus. PE 11.3.
inaccessible, πέτραι Arist. HA 563a5, cf. Plu. Alex. 58, Luc. Prom. 1; ἀποτίβ. νοῦσος unapproachable, S. Tr. 1030 (lyr.), cf. Max.Tyr. 18.1.
not to be looked at, EM 433.49.
without want of anything, LXX 1 Ma. 12.9, al., Phld. D. 3.13; φιλοσοφίας Plu. Sanit. 2.122f, cf. Isid. 381b, Luc. Hist.Conscr. 36: abs., self-sufficient, Plu. Comp.Arist.Cat. 4, Plot. 5.9.4.
= foreg., Plb. 21.23.4; διδασκαλίας Phld. Rh. 1.194S.
not to be pointed out, A. Supp. 794 cod. (lyr., -μεικτος Headlam).
inadmissible, BGU 1113.21 (i B. C.), S.E. P. 2.229.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., not giving heed to, συμβουλίας Phld. Vit. p.34J., dub. in Id. D. 3. Fr. 42; unacceptable, Plb. 36.12.4; θυσία IG 3.73.14, 74.8; εὐχὴ ἀ. ὑπὸ θεοῦ Porph. Marc. 24.
unconnected with the worship of Dionysus, Plu. QConv. 2.671f.

children.label: II
children.definition: not to the point, mal à propos, proverbial like οὐδὲν πρὸς Διόνυσον, Cic. Att. 16.13a. 1, Plu. QConv. 2.612e, Luc. Bacch. 6.

undefined, Ulp.ad D. 24.68; unqualified, Heliod. in EN 109.19; of propositions, indefinite in quantification, Ammon. in APr. 14.37. Adv. -τως without distinction, Gal. 16.558; par excellence, Olymp. in Mete. 123.3.

unexpected, unlooked for, A. Pr. 680, S. El. 1017, etc.; εὐπραγία Th. 3.39; πρᾶγμʼ ἡμῖν ἰδεῖν ἀ. Ar. Lys. 352; κακοπάθεια Antipho 3.2.11; τύχη Pl. Lg. 920d; ἀ. [ὁδὸν] πορευθείς X. HG 6.4.3; ἐξ ἀπροσδοκήτου Hdt. 1.191, 7.204. Adv. -τως Th. 4.29, Lys. 1.11, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., not expecting, unaware, ἐπιθέσθαι τισὶ ἀπροσδοκήτοις Th. 2.33, cf. 7.39; ἀ. ἦσαν ὡς ἤδη μαχούμενοι Id. 6.69; ἀ. μὴ ἄν ποτέ τινα σφίσιν ἐπιθέσθαι Id. 7.29.

data.quote: ἀ. μὴ ἄν ποτέ τινα σφίσιν ἐπιθέσθαι

children.definition: non-expectation, Pl. Def. 412c.
gloss on ἀπρόσιτος, Hsch.
unsunned, E. Fr. 845.
to be heedless, inattentive, Eustr. in APo. 258.6.
heedless, careless, Tz.ad Lyc. 314. Adv. -τως unconcernedly, Porph. Sent. 32.
not taken up, of an inheritance, Just. Nov. 1.1.3, cf. Suid.
want of attention, Arr. Epict. 4.12.5, Sext. Sent. 280a, etc.
want of intercourse, Poet. ap. Arist. EN 1157b13.
not to be accosted, unapproachable, of a man, S. OC 1277; of a lion, Id. Tr. 1093; without intercourse or conversation, Plu. QConv. 2.679a.
ungentle, harsh, Sch. Pi. P. 2.10.
suspend judgement, Timo 80.
not added to, Theol.Ar. 30.
untouched, not to be touched, Hsch. s.v. ἀπροτίμαστος.
unattainable, ἔρωτες Pi. N. 11.48.

unapproachable, inaccessible, ὄρη Plb. 3.49.7, cf. Str. 1.3.18; φῶς 1 Ep.Ti. 6.16; of persons, Cic. Att. 5.20.6, cf. Plu. Adul. 2.68e; καταφυγή D.S. 19.96: metaph., λόγοις ἀ. παρρησία Plu. Alc. 4; δύναμις τοῦ λόγου Luc. Dem.Enc. 32. Adv. -τως Plu. Aud. 2.45f.
unseasonably, Sch. Ptol. Tetr. 158.
unforeseen, not thought of, X. Lac. 13.7.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., improvident, D. 51.15. Adv. -τως Antiph. 195.

without summons to attend a trial, IG 1.27a10, Hyp. Fr. 2; ἀ. δίκη a prosecution in support of which no πρόσκλησις has been issued, D. 53.15; ἐπιβολή ib. 14; γνῶσις Id. 21.92; without notice, ὑμέναιος Hld. 6.8; unsummoned, Id. 8.1.
not adhering, τινί Eust. 1940.20.
not stumbling, void of offence, Ep.Phil. 1.10; συνείδησις Act.Ap. 24.16.
free from harm, ἄτρυτος καί ἀ. IG 5(2).20.19 ( Tegea, i B. C.); [ θεοί] σεδιαφυλάσσουσιν ἀ. PGiss. 17.7 (ii A.D.), cf. PBaden 39 iii 14 (ii A. D.). Adv. -πως ib. 79iv8 (ii A.D.).

children.label: II
children.definition: giving no offence, τινί S.E. M. 1.195, 1 Ep.Cor. 10.32.
unseeing, A. Eu. 105.

children.label: II
children.definition: unexplored, ὁδός LXX Si. 35(32).21.
without offence, IG 14.404. Adv. -τως without stumbling, τρέχειν Eust. 925.28.
not satiating or disgusting, Men.Rh. p.340 S., Hld. 6.1.

children.label: II
children.definition: insatiate, πρὸς τὰς ἡδονάς Cat.Cod.Astr. 8(4).178.19.
free from blows, ἕλκη φυλάττειν ἀ. Hierocl. p.25A.

children.label: II
children.definition: not taking offence, πρός τινα Plu. in Hes. 65 [fr. 86 Sandbach].
not taking or admitting a construction, A.D. Pron. 14.15, Synt. 63.21.
not to the point, Sch. Ar. V. 1311, al. Adv. -γως Plb. 9.36.6.
irresistible, S. Tr. 1098; τινί Luc. Tox. 48.
against whom no device avails, Sch. Il. 16.29.
= sq. [ἀπρόσμικτος], Steph.Byz. s.v. Σῆρες, Eust. ad D.P. 752.
holding no communion with, ξένοισι Hdt. 1.65: abs., solitary, isolated, Poll. 3.64. Adv. -τως Id. 5.139.
not turned to profit, JHS 38.188 (Iconium, dub.).
without approach, inaccessible, βίος Phryn.Com. 18; ὄρη Procop. Goth. 4.16.

children.label: II
children.definition: not yielding a return, unproductive, Phld. Oec. p.35J.
hard to associate with or deal with, A. Pers. 91 (lyr.). Adv. -τως unsociably, Isoc. 9.49.
unsociable, γῆρας S. OC 1236.
not to be looked at, faced, ἀστραπή Poll. 1.117.
not to be looked on, frightful, πόνος Pi. O. 2.67; epith. of Κύρβας, Orph. H. 39.2.
where one cannot land, D.S. 20.74, Sch. S. Ph. 214.
without affection or passion, Hierocl. in CA 11p.438M.
unapproachable, Str. 1.2.9, Plu. Ant. 70.
not to be interwoven, Sch. Ar. Ra. 1340.
unfeigned, in Adv. -τως D.S. 32.24.
Hp. Ep. 17.
freedom from error, Alex.Aphr. de An. 150.35.
unaddressed, ἀ. τινὰ καταλιπεῖν Jul. Ep. 182, cf. Poll. 5.137, 138.
without προστάτης or guardian, Ph. 1.170; of the universe, ib. 696.

definition: ἀπροστασίου γραφή indictment of a μέτοικος

children.definition: for not having chosen a προστάτης or patron, D. 35.48; ἀ. δίκη Arist. Ath. 58.3, Hyp. Fr. 15.
without a leader or guide, J. AJ 20.8.8, Ael. NA 15.8, f.l.for sq. in Hierocl. p.54A.

definition: ἀπροστάτητος [τᾰ], ον, = foreg., M.Ant. 12.14; οἶκος Hierocl. p.54A.
ἀπρόστατος, ον, = foreg., dub. in D.C. 78.20.

children.definition: without penalty, Ἀρχ. Δελτ. 2.269 ( Coronea, i B. C.).

children.label: II
children.definition: ἀπροστίματον· ἀπροσδόκητον, ἀπρόσβατον, Hsch.
without sharp edge, ξίφος Magn. 7.
Hsch.
unfriendly, hostile, Hld. 5.7.
dangerous, νήσους ναύταις ἀπροσφόρους E. IA 287 (lyr.); unsuitable, Herod.Med. ap. Orib. 10.18.6; incongruous, Tz. ad Hes. Op. 735. Adv. -ρως Steph. in Hp. 1.223D.
incongruous, Eust. 178.37; unrelated, Tz. H. 8.158. Adv. -ῶς Eust. 529.31.
not belonging to the tribe, Hld. 4.8 (dub. l.).
without accosting, Aesop. 35.
not accosted, Cic. Att. 8.8.1.
unnoticed, unremarked, Plu. Gen.Socr. 2.575b, Sch. A.R. 1.645.
aequiformis, of verses, Diom. p.498K.
arrogant, Gloss.
not to be touched, Hdn. Epim. 57.
not respecting persons, Suid. s.v. ἀδυσώπητος. Adv. -τως without respect of persons, 1 Ep.Pet. 1.17.
without a face, i.e. without beauty of face, opp. εὐπρόσωπος, Pl. Chrm. 154d, cf. Ael. NA 14.18; of a country, Chor. p.223 B.

children.label: II
children.definition: without a mask, undisguised, ἀγνωμοσύνη Aristid. 1.409 J.

children.label: III
children.definition: impersonal, Phld. Lib. p.29O., AB 420. Adv. -πως Aphth. Prog. 4.
unhoped for, Opp. C. 3.422 (v.l. ἀπροτίοπτον).

definition: ἀπροτίμαστος, ον, Ep. for ἀπρόσμαστος, ( μαίομαι)

children.definition: untouched, undefiled, of Briseis, Il. 19.263.

children.label: II
children.definition: unapproachable, of Homer, Euph. 118.
invisible, obscure, Man. 2.19, Opp. H. 3.159, Q.S. 7.73, Ath.Mitt. 27.339 (Acarn.).
unexpected, f.l. in Orph. A. 787.

offering no excuse, unhesitating, ready, προθυμία Th. 6.83; εὔνοια Lys. Fr. 114; σύμμαχοι X. Cyr. 2.4.10; συνεραστής Timocl. 8. Adv. -τως without disguise, Th. 1.49, etc.: without evasion, honestly, Id. 6.72, IG 2.243, etc.; unhesitatingly, D.C. 38.39.

children.label: II
children.definition: admitting no excuse, implacable, θάνατος E. Ba. 1002.

children.label: III
children.definition: inexcusable, κακία Plu. Cat.Mi. 44, cf. 2.742c.
unforetold, unexpected, Arat. 424, 768, A.R. 2.268, Nic. Al. 598. Adv. -τως A.R. 1.1201, 2.580, Orph. A. 787.

children.label: II
children.definition: unutterable, terrific, A.R. 1.645.

children.label: III
children.definition: without parley, in Adv. -τως Id. 2.62, 4.1005.
not guarded against, unforeseen, Th. 4.55. Adv. -τως D.C. 38.41, Ach.Tat. 8.1.
unguarded, Opp. H. 5.106.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., using no precautions, Hld. 6.13.
not announced beforehand, Sch. Od. 4.727.
not silted up, λιμένες Men.Rh. p.351 S.
without payment of πρυτανεῖα (q.v.), δίκαι Milet. 3 No.147.31.
smoothness of rhythm in music, Pl. Lg. 669e.

not stumbling, ἀπταιστστερον παρέχειν τὸν ἵππον make a horse less apt to stumble, X. Eq. 1.6: metaph., ἄ ἐν τῷ βίῳ Epict. Gnom. 52; δώμασιν ἀ. Limen. 43, cf. M.Ant. 5.9; βίος Luc. Am. 46; infallible, Plot. 5.3.17, Alex.Aphr. in Metaph. 713.12; ἀλήθεια Iamb. Myst. 3.31; θεοὶ διδασκάλων -ότατοι Max.Tyr. 38.1. Adv. -τως Pl. Tht. 144b; inevitably, Gal. 14.230: Comp. -ότερον with greater precision, Ptol. Tetr. 177:—also ἀπταιστί, Hdn. Epim. 256.
intact, Plu. QConv. 2.691d.

children.label: II
children.definition: not causing to stumble, giving a good footing, λεία καὶ ἄ. ὁδός Max.Tyr. 5.2 [34.2.f].
Hsch. ἀπταρύσσεται· πέτεται, Id.; cf. ἀπτερύσσομαι.
one must cling to a thing, bestow pains upon it, μουσικῆς Pl. R. 377a, cf. Epicur. Fr. 461; one must partake of, πλακοῦντος Alex. 250, cf. Gal. 11.371, Porph. Abst. 2.44.
quickly, swiftly, Hes. Fr. 96.46, Parm. 1.17, A.R. 4.1765. (Expld. as = αἰφνιδίως by Hdn.Gr. 2.230; cf. ἄπτερος III, ἀπτέρωτος II.)

without wings, unwinged, Hom. only in Od., and always in phrase τῇ δʼ ἄπτερος ἔπλετο μῦθος the speech was to her without wings, remained unuttered, opp. ἔπεα πτερόεντα, 17.57; ἄ. φάτις unspoken rumour, A. Ag. 278; ἄπτερα πωτήματα wingless flight, Id. Eu. 250; ἄ. δρόμος, of the Trojan horse, v.l. in Tryph. 85.
ἄπτερα, opp. πτερωτά, without wings, of insects, Arist. HA 523b17; ἄπτερον, τό, Id. PA 642b33.

children.label: II
children.definition: unfeathered, of Harpies, A. Eu. 51; ἄνθρωπος ζῷον ἄ. Pl. Def. 415a; ὄρνις (i.e. the Chorus) E. IT 1095 (lyr.); of arrows, Hdt. 7.92.
unfledged, callow, ἄ. ὠδὶν τέκνων E. HF 1039, cf. Pl. Phdr. 256d.

children.label: III
children.definition: ἀ-, = sṃ-) ἄ. τάχος of great speed, Trag.Adesp. 429; cf. ἄπτερα· ἰσόπτερα, ταχέα, ἡδέα, Hsch. Adv. -ρως Lyc. 627 ( ὁμοπτέρως, ταχέως, Sch.).
without wings, Hedyle ap. Ath. 7.297b.
flap the wings, Arat. 1009.

definition: ἀπτερύσσομαι, = foreg., Archil. 49 Diehl (ap. Sch. Arat. 1009); cf. ἀπταρύσσεται.

children.definition: unfeathered, of arrows or bolts, IG 2.809e19.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἀπτέρωτα· ταχέα, αἰφνίδια, Hsch.; cf. ἀπτερέως, ἄπτερος III.
unfledged, callow, ἀπτῆσι νεοσσοῖσι Il. 9.323: metaph. of men, ἀπτῆνα τυτθόν Com.Adesp. 1291.

children.label: II
children.definition: unwinged, βροτοί Ar. Av. 687; πεζοῖς τε καὶ ἀπτῆσι (sc. ζῴοις) Pl. Plt. 276a.
able to come into contact with, ἀλλήλων Arist. GC 322b27.
τὴν ἁ. αἴσθησιν the sense of touch, Id. de An. 413b9, cf. Alex.Aphr. Pr. Praef.; τὸ ἁ. Arist. de An. 415a3; γλῶττα ἁπτικωτάτη most sensitive to touch, Id. PA 660a21. Adv. -κῶς Olymp. in Alc. p.40C.
acting on, c. gen., τοῦ νευρώδους Dsc. 2.179.
unfledged, Jul. Ep. 191.
not winnowed or ground, Hp. VM 14.
reckless in speech, Il. 8.209 (v.l. ἁπτοεπής: fort. ἀεπτο-επής uttering unspeakable words (for ἀϝεπτο-, cf. ϝέπος)).
undaunted, LXX Je. 26(46).28, Nonn. D. 22.355, Sch. Il. 1.56, etc. Adv. -τως, θνῄσκειν Phalar. Ep. 103.2.
unwarlike, Orac. ap. Ath. 12.524b.

definition: ἀπτόλεμος, ον, poet. for ἀπόλεμος, Il. 2.201, E. Med. 640 (lyr.), etc.

children.definition: tangible, ὁρατὰ ἢ ἁ. σώματα Pl. R. 525d, cf. Ti. 32b, al., Arist. de An. 424a12, Thphr. Od. 64, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἁπτά· φάρμακα, Hsch.

definition: ἅπτρα, ἡ, Dim. ἅπτριον, τό, ( ἅπτω B)

children.definition: wick of a lamp, Sch. D.T. p.195 H.
without expectoration, πλευρῖτις Hp. Coac. 375, cf. Gal. 17(1).491.

definition: ἅπτω, fut. ἅψω: aor. ἧψα:— Pass., pf. ἧμμαι, Ion. ἅμμαι Hdt. 1.86: fut. ἅψομαι Od. 9.379, ἁφθήσομαι ( συν-) Gal. 3.311:— Med., v. infr. (cf. ἑάφθη):—

children.definition: fasten or bind to, used by Hom., once in Act., ἅψας ἀμφοτέρωθεν . . ἔντερον οἰός (of a lyre-string) Od. 21.408; once in Med., ἁψαμένη βρόχον . . ἀφʼ ὑψηλοῖο μελάθρου having fastened the noose to the beam (to hang herself), 11.278; so later ἅψεται ἀμφὶ βρόχον . . δείρᾳ E. Hipp. 770; ἁψαμένη βρόχον αὐχένι A.R. 1.1065:— Act., βρόχους ἅ. κρεμαστούς E. Or. 1036; but βρόχῳ ἅ. δέρην Id. Hel. 136, cf. AP 7.493 ( Antip. Thess.).
join, ἅ. χορόν A. Eu. 307; πάλην τινὶ ἅ. fasten a contest in wrestling on one, engage with one, Id. Ch. 868: — Pass., ἅπτεσθαι τὴν Μεγαρέων πόλιν καὶ Κορινθίων τοῖς τείχεσιν Arist. Pol. 1280b14.

data.quote: ἅπτεσθαι τὴν Μεγαρέων πόλιν καὶ Κορινθίων τοῖς τείχεσιν

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., ἅπτομαι, fut. ἅψομαι, aor. ἡψάμην E. Supp. 317, with pf. Pass. ἧμμαι S. Tr. 1010 (lyr.), Pl. Phdr. 260e:— fasten oneself to, grasp, c.gen., ἅψασθαι γούνων Il. 1.512; χειρῶν 10.377; ἁψαμένη δὲ γενείου Ὀδυσσῆα προσέειπεν Od. 19.473; ἅπτεσθαι νηῶν Il. 2.152; βρώμης δʼ οὐχ ἅπτεαι οὐδὲ ποτῆτος; Od. 10.379, cf. 4.60; ὡς δʼ ὅτε τίς τε κύων συὸς . . ἅπτηται κατόπισθε . . ἰσχία τε γλουτούς τε Il. 8.339; ἅπτεσθαι τοῦ ἐπεόντος ἐπὶ τῶν δενδρέων καρποῦ Hdt. 2.32; τῶν τύμβων ἁπτόμενοι Id. 4.172; ἅπτεσθαί τινος, Lat. manus inicere alicui, Id. 3.137; οὔτʼ ἔθιγεν οὔθʼ ἥψαθʼ ἡμῶν E. Ba. 617; τῶν σφυγμῶν feel the pulse, Arr. Epict. 3.22.73: metaph., take hold of, cleave to, Pl. Lg. 967c.

data.quote: βρώμης δʼ οὐχ ἅπτεαι οὐδὲ ποτῆτος;
ὡς δʼ ὅτε τίς τε κύων συὸς . . ἅπτηται κατόπισθε . . ἰσχία τε γλουτούς τε
ἅπτεσθαι τοῦ ἐπεόντος ἐπὶ τῶν δενδρέων καρποῦ

children.label: b
children.definition: τῶν μὲν γὰρ πάντων βέλεʼ ἅπτεται for the spears of all the Trojans reach their mark, Il. 17.631; ἀμφοτέρων βέλεʼ ἥπτετο 8.67.

children.label: c
children.definition: ἅ. τῆς γῆς land, D.S. 4.48.

children.label: III
children.definition: engage in, undertake, βουλευμάτων S. Ant. 179; ἀγῶνος E. Supp. 317; πολέμου prosecute it vigorously, Th. 5.61; ἧπται τοῦ πράγματος D. 21.155; ψυχὴ ἡμμένη φόνων Pl. Phd. 108b, cf. E. IT 381; τῶν μεγίστων ἀσεβημάτων Plb. 7.13.6; so ἅ. τῆς μουσικῆς καὶ φιλοσοφίας Pl. R. 411c; ἐπιτηδεύματος ib. 497e; γεωμετρίας Id. Plt. 266a; τῆς θαλάττης Plb. 1.24.7; ἅπτεσθαι λόγου E. Andr. 662, Pl. Euthd. 283a (but ἅπτεσθαι τοῦ λόγου attack, impugn the argument of another, Id. Phd. 86d); τούτων ἥψατο touched on these points, handled them, Th. 1.97; ἅ. τῆς ζητήσεως Arist. GC 320b34; but also, touch on, treat superficially, Pl. Lg. 694c, Arist. EE 1227a1.

children.label: b
children.definition: begin, set to work, ταῖς διανοίαις Ar. Ec. 581.

fasten upon, attack, Pi. N. 8.22, A. Ag. 1608, etc.; μόνον τῷ δακτύλῳ Ar. Lys. 365; τῆς οὐραγίας Plb. 2.34.12; esp. with words, Hdt. 5.92.γʹ; of diseases, ἧπταί μου S. Tr. 1010, cf. Gal. 15.702; ἥψατο τῶν ἀνθρώπων Th. 2.48; ὅσα ἅπτεται ἀνθρώπων all that feed on human flesh, ib. 50.

children.label: b
children.definition: lay hands on, χρημάτων Pl. Lg. 913a; τῶν ἀλλοτρίων Id. R. 360b, etc.

touch, affect, ἄλγος οὐδὲν ἅπτεται νεκροῦ A. Fr. 255, cf. S. OC 955; ἅπτει μου τοῖς λόγοις τῆς ψυχῆς Pl. Ion 535a; τῆς ἐμῆς ἥψω φρενός E. Rh. 916; ὥς μου χρησμὸς ἅ. φρενῶν Ar. Eq. 1237; make an impression upon, ἡμῶν OGI 315.56 ( Pessinus, ii B. C.).

data.quote: ἅπτει μου τοῖς λόγοις τῆς ψυχῆς

children.definition: grasp with the senses, perceive, S. OC 1550, Pl. Phd. 99e; apprehend, τῆς αἰτίας Arist. Resp. 472a3.
have intercourse with a woman, Pl. Lg. 840a, Arist. Pol. 1335b40, 1 Ep.Cor. 7.1; εὐνῆς E. Ph. 946.

come up to, reach, overtake, X. HG 5.4.43; attain, τῆς ἀληθείας Pl. Phd. 65b; τοῦ τέλους Id. Smp. 211b: in Pi., c. dat., ἀγλαΐαις P. 10.28; στάλαισιν Ἡρακλείαις Id. I. 4(3).12; but also c. gen., Ἡρακλέος σταλᾶν Id. O. 3.44.
make use of, avail oneself of, τῆς τύχης E. IA 56.

to be in contact, Arist. Ph. 231a22, cf. Metaph. 1002a34, al., S.E. M. 3.35; of lines or curves, meet, Euc. 3 Def. 2; touch, Id. 4 Def. 5, Archim. Sph.Cyl. 1.28; pass through a point, Euc. 4 Defs. 2,6; of points, lie on a line or curve, ib. Defs. 1,3; ἅπτεται τὸ σημεῖον θέσει δεδομένης εὐθείας the locus of the point is a given straight line, Id. ap. Papp. 656.6, al.

children.label: B
children.definition: Act., kindle, set on fire (i.e. by contact of fire), Hdt. 8.52, etc. (so in Med., Call. Dian. 116); ἐρείκης θωμὸν ἅψαντες πυρί A. Ag. 295: metaph., πυρσὸν ὕμνων Pi. I. 4(3).43:— Pass., to be set on fire, ὁ μοχλὸς ἐλάϊνος ἐν πυρὶ μέλλεν ἅψεσθαι Od. 9.379; ὡς ἅφθη τάχιστα τὸ λήιον . . ἅψατο νηοῦ as soon as the corn caught fire, it set fire to the temple, Hdt. 1.19; πυρῆς ἤδη ἁμμένης ib. 86; ἧπται πυρί E. Hel. 107.

data.quote: ὁ μοχλὸς ἐλάϊνος ἐν πυρὶ μέλλεν ἅψεσθαι

children.label: II
children.definition: ἅ. πῦρ kindle a fire, ib. 503:— Pass., ἄνθρακες ἡμμένοι red-hot embers, Th. 4.100; δᾷδʼ ἐνεγκάτω τις ἡμμένην Ar. Nu. 1490, cf. Pl. 301.

children.label: III
children.definition: cook, Alex. 124.1.
brooch, POxy. 1273.8 (iii A.D.).
without hares, Hdn.Gr. 1.46.
not falling or liable to fall, ἀ. δόλος, of a wrestlerʼs art, Pi. O. 9.92; λόγος Pl. R. 534c; ἀ. ἑστάναι M.Ant. 7.61; ἀ. ἑαυτὸν διατηρεῖν Plu. Comp.Arist.Cat. 2.
never thrown, of a wrestler, IG 14.1106, TAM 2.301.
faultless, Longin. 33.4, cf. Ph. 1.678.

children.label: II
children.definition: without cases, ῥῆμα στοιχεῖον λόγου ἄ. Apollod.Stoic. 3.213, cf. D.T. 638.3, A.D. Synt. 176.5, al.
not involving different cases, of a geometrical problem, Procl. in Euc. p.222F.

children.label: III
children.definition: Adv. ἀπτώ-τως, ἔχειν to be secure, Corn. ND 9; infallibly, with certainty, S.E. M. 8.187.

definition: ἀπύ, Aeol., Arc., Thess. for ἀπό: —ἀπυδόσμιος, ἀπυ-δοσμός, v. ἀπο-.

children.definition: without buttocks, Semon. 7.76, Pl.Com. 184.3.

without bottom or base, κύλιξ Thphr. Fr. 94; φιάλη Parth. ap. Ath. 11.501a, cf. Dsc. Eup. 1.235; γῆ ἀπύθμενον θεώρημα Secund. Sent. 14:—also ἀπυθμένιστος, ον, Eust. 870.28: ἀπύθμην, ενος, ὁ, ἡ, Theognost. Can. 86.
not dense, not compressed, Ptol. Geog. 8.1.4.
not included in the πυκνόν (q.v.), Cleonid. Harm. 4, etc.
not secured by gates, X. HG 5.4.20; στόμα Ar. Ra. 838 (v.l. ἀθύρωτον).
not suppurating, Suid.
untowered, unfortified, E. Fr. 749.
not girt with towers, Od. 11.264.
absence of fever, time or state free from fever, Gal. 17(1).69, cf. 19.399.

free from fever, Hp. Aph. 4.20, Luc. Philops. 25, POxy. 1582.9 (ii A.D.); not inducing fever, δίαιτα Hp. Art. 69; βίος Antiph. 226.6; relieving fever, ἀντίδοτος Archig. ap. Gal. 13.173:— perh. to be read for ἀπύρευτος f.l. in Thphr. Char. 3.6.
probe without a knob ( πυρήν), Hp. ap. Gal. 19.85.
without stone or kernel, pipless, ῥοά Ar. Fr. 118, Thphr. HP 4.13.2; φοῖνιξ Arist. de An. 422a29, Fr. 267.

children.label: II
children.definition: with no spine, ἰχθύς (i.e. ἔγχελυς) Archestr. Fr. 8 codd.
loaf, Poll. 6.33.
without fire, in Hom. only of pots and tripods, that have not yet been on the fire, brand-new, ἕπτʼ ἀπύρους τρίποδας Il. 9.122, cf. 23.267.

children.label: b
children.definition: not capable of standing on the fire, σκευῶν ἐμπύρων καὶ ἀ. Pl. Lg. 679a, cf. Ar. Fr. 532.

children.label: c
children.definition: not wasted by fire, Max.Tyr. 41.4.
ἄ. οἶκος fireless, i.e. cold, cheerless, Hes. Op. 525.
unfermented, οἶνος Alcm. 117; uncooked, σιτία Plu. Glor.Ath. 2.349a; ἄκολος AP 9.563 ( Leon.), etc.

ἄ. χρυσίον unsmelted, opp. ἄπεφθον, Hdt. 3.97, IG 2.652 B28 (but ἄ. χρυσός, of nuggets, or gold-dust, Arist. Mir. 833b8, D.S. 2.50, al.); ἄ. κύανος Thphr. Lap. 55; ἄ. τέχναι Aristid. Or. 37(2).13; θεῖον ἄ. native sulphur, Gal. 12.903.

ἱερὰ ἄ. sacrifices in which no fire was used, i. e. offerings of fruit, grain, and wine, Pi. O. 7.48, cf. A. Ag. 70 (lyr.), S. Fr. 417; θυσίαν ἄπυρον παγκαρπείας E. Fr. 912.4; ἄ. βωμοί Ph. 1.345; ἱερουργία Plu. Gen.Socr. 2.578b.
A. Pr. 880 (lyr.) ἄ. ἄρδις an arrow-point but one not forged in fire, i. e. the sting of the gad-fly; ἄ. δᾴς, of love, Luc. DDeor. 23[19].1.

children.label: II
children.definition: without fever, Hp. Epid. 1.1, cf. Aret. SD 1.9. Adv. ἀπύρως Hp. Prorrh. 1.119.

children.label: III
children.definition: Hsch.
not exposed to fire, brand-new, φιάλη Il. 23.270; uncooked, Thphr. Od. 10; of the moon in eclipse, not fiery, Placit. 2.29.2; incombustible, Thphr. Lap. 19, 22.
not heard of, ᾤχετʼ ἄϊστος ἄ. Od. 1.242, cf. Sapph. 96.19 L.-P., Opp. C. 1.236.
inaudible, ἄπυστα φωνῶν S. OC 489.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., without hearing or learning a thing, οὐδὲ δὴν ἦεν ἄ. Ζεύς Od. 5.127: c. gen., μύθων 4.675; κακῶν ἔτι πάμπαν ἀπύστω IG 14.1389ii16.

definition: ἀπφά or ἄπφα, a term of endearment used by brothers and sisters, also by lovers, Eust. 565.23.
ἀπφάριον [φᾰ], Dim. of ἀπφά, Xenarch. 4.15, CIG 3277 ( Smyrna).
ἀπφίδιον [ φῑ], τό, Sch. Luc. Cat. 12, and ἀπφίον, τό, Eust. 565.23, Dim. of ἀπφά; also ἀπφία Poll. 3.74, cf. Hsch.
ἀπφῦς (for the accent cf. Hdn.Gr. 2.936), gen. ύος, ὁ,

children.definition: papa, Theoc. 15.14:— Eust. (v. foreg.) expld. as ὁ ἀφʼ οὗ ἔφυ.
beardless, Suid.
Plu. Stoic.rep. 2.1043b: metaph., go wrong, τοσοῦτον μόνον . . ἀπῴδησεν ὁ ἄνθρωπος prob. in Phld. Po. 994.4.
out of tune, E. Cyc. 490 (lyr.), Ph. 1.375, Luc. Icar. 17: metaph., out of harmony with, c. gen., Id. Salt. 65: abs., Ph. 2.170, Luc. Pisc. 34, A.D. Synt. 307.14.

children.label: II
children.definition: having ceased to crow or sing, ἀλεκτρυών Luc. Lex. 6; of a person, Him. Or. 22.5.

definition: ἄπωθεν (in late Poets also ἄπωθε, Q.S. 6.647, AP 7.172 ( Antip. Sid.)), Adv.

children.definition: from afar or afar, S. Ant. 1206, Tr. 816, E. Heracl. 674, Ar. Av. 1184, etc.; οἱ ἄπωθεν strangers, outsiders, Arist. Rh. 1371a12, al.
far from, νεώς E. IT 108, cf. Ar. Pl. 674, Th. 3.111, Babr. 1.12; cf. ἄποθεν.

definition: ἀπωθέω, fut. inf. ἀπωσέμεν Il. 13.367: aor. ἀπέωσα Od. 9.81, ἀπῶσα prob. corrupt in S. Fr. 479:— Med., fut. ἀπεώσομαι LXX 4 Ki. 21.14: aor. ἀπωσάμην Hom. (v. infr.), ἀπεωσάμην Th. 1.32, etc., ἀπωθησάμην D.C. 38.28 codd.: pf. ἀπῶσμαι· ἀπώθησα, Hsch., inf. ἀπεῶσθαι Th. 2.39:— Pass., pf. part. ἀπωσμένος Phld. Ir. p.33 W.:—

children.definition: thrust away, push back, ὤϊξε πύλας καὶ ἀπῶσεν ὀχῆας Il. 24.446, cf. 21.537; ἀ. ἐπάλξεις pushed them off the wall, Th. 3.23:— Med., thrust away from oneself, χερσὶν ἀπώσασθαι λίθον Od. 9.305; ἀπώσατο ἦκα γέροντα pushed him gently away, Il. 24.508; αἱ χεῖρες τὸ τόξον -οῦνταί τε καὶ προσέλκονται Pl. R. 439b.

data.quote: αἱ χεῖρες τὸ τόξον -οῦνταί τε καὶ προσέλκονται

children.definition: drive away, ἠέρα μὲν σκέδασεν καὶ ἀπῶσεν ὀμίχλην [Ζεύς] Il. 17.649; of the wind, beat from oneʼs course, Βορέης ἀπέωσε Od. 9.81 (so in Med., σφέας κεῖθεν ἀπώσατο ἲς ἀνέμοιο 13.276).

εἴ κέ μιν οὐδοῦ ἀπώσομεν 22.76, cf. 2.130; γῆς ἀπῶσαί [με] πατρίδος S. OT 641:— Med., thrust from oneself, drive away, μνηστῆρας ἀπώσεαι ἐκ μεγάροιο Od. 1.270:— Pass., to be expelled, Hdt. 1.173; ἀπωθοῦμαι δόμων Ar. Ach. 450; γῆς S. OT 670.
thrust aside, spurn, Id. Aj. 446, al.:— Pass., τὸν δῆμον πρότερον ἀπωσμένον pushed aside, Hdt. 5.69.

repel, drive back, in Med., Τρῶας ἀπώσασθαι Il. 8.206; νεῖκος ἀπωσαμένους 12.276; ἀπώσασθαι κακὰ νηῶν 15.503; νηῶν μὲν ἀπωσάμενοι δήϊον πῦρ 16.301; πένθος Archil. 9.10; νοῦσον AP 6.190 ( Gaet.):— also in Prose, Antipho 4.4.6, etc.: c. dupl. acc., τὴν ναυμαχίαν ἀπεωσάμεθα Κορινθίους Th. 1.32.

Med., reject, τὸ ἀργύριον Hdt. 1.199; τὸν αὐλόν S. Tr. 216 (lyr.); φιλότητα Id. Ph. 1122 (lyr.); τὰς σπονδάς Th. 5.22; τὰ ἐξ ἀδικίας κέρδη Pl. R. 366a; ἀ. πόνους decline them, E. Fr. 789; τὴν δουλοσύνην shake off slavery, Hdt. 1.95; ὕπνον shake off sleep, Pl. R. 571c: abs., refuse, ποιήσω κοὐκ ἀπώσομαι S. Tr. 1249.
rejection, repulsion, χυμῶν Steph. in Hp. 1.72 D.
one who repels, Gloss.
thrust or driven away, rejected, Suid.
refusal, PFay. 21.24 (ii A. D.) (fort. ἀπειθίας).
destruction, Arist. EN 1120a2, etc.: pl., Id. Mete. 351b11.

children.label: II
children.definition: loss, Id. Pr. 952b26; opp. τήρησις, Plb. 6.59.5 Schweigh., cf. BGU 1058.35, al. (i B. C.); τῶν χρόνων ἀ. Diog.Oen. 1.
perdition, Ep.Rom. 9.22, 2 Ep.Thess. 2.3.
thing lost, LXX Le. 6.3 ( 5.22).
ruining oneʼs house, μειράκιον Com.Adesp. 848.
unbroken, Anon. ap. Suid.
Pl.Com. 199.
without a lid, Babr. 60.1, Gal. 17(2).161.

definition: ἄπωμος, ον, = foreg., Gp. 6.1.4, Zos.Alch. p.113B.

children.definition: denial upon oath, as law-term, opp. ἐξωμοσία, Poll. 8.54, cf. Hsch.
of or for denial on oath, ἐπίρρημα (i.e. μά) D.T. 642.15, Eust. 54.23. Adv. -κῶς Id. 92.22, Sch. Il. 1.85.
abjured, declared impossible on oath, χρημάτων ἄελπτον οὐδέν ἐστιν οὐδʼ ἀ. Archil. 74; βροτοῖσιν οὐδέν ἐστʼ ἀ. S. Ant. 388; πρᾶγμʼ ἀ. Eup. 217; οὐδὲν ἀ. οὐδὲ ἄπρακτον ποιεῖσθαι D.Chr. 4.102.

data.quote: χρημάτων ἄελπτον οὐδέν ἐστιν οὐδʼ ἀ.

children.label: II
children.definition: under oath not to do a thing, καίπερ ὢν ἀ. S. Ant. 394; κἀν ἀ. τις ᾖ Trag.Adesp. 566.
buy, purchase, ἀπωνηθήσεται Theopomp.Com. 84.
dig up, PFlor. 369.5 (ii A. D.).
layering of ἀπώρυγες II, POxy. 1692.14 (ii A. D.), cf. 1631.10 (iii A. D.).
canal from a place, ἀπώρυγες συχναί Procop. Vand. 2.19 (Scalig., for ἀπορρῶγες): metaph. of Samos, ἀ. τῆς πόλεως Demad. Fr. 4 S., cf. Phld. Rh. 1.181 S.

children.label: II
children.definition: layer of a vine, LXX Ez. 17.6, Gp. 5.18.1, POxy. 1631.10 (iii A.D.).
absence of callus, Paul.Aeg. 6.110.
not forming a callus, of fractured bones, Dsc. 1.70.
repelling evil, θεοί IG 14.957; ἄνεμοι ἀ. BMus.Inscr. 370 ( Delos).
repelling waves, AP 6.90 ( Phil.)
thrusting or driving away, διὰ τὴν τοῦ ἀνέμου ἄπωσιν αὐτῶν Th. 7.34, cf. Aret. SD 1.14.

data.quote: διὰ τὴν τοῦ ἀνέμου ἄπωσιν αὐτῶν

children.definition: repulsion, opp. ἕλξις, Arist. Ph. 243a19.
one must reject, E. HF 294.
one that drives away, ἄνεμος Eust. 1741.22; cf. ἐξώστης.
rejecting, δύναμις Gal. Nat.Fac. 3.8.
thrust or driven away from, τῆς ἑωυτοῦ (sc. γῆς) Hdt. 6.5, cf. S. Aj. 1019.

children.label: II
children.definition: that can be driven away, οὐδὲ ἀπωστοὶ ἔσονται Hdt. 1.71.
farthest from, τῆς Θρᾴκης D. 23.166, cf. Trag.Adesp. 130 (lyr.).
farther off, = μακρότερος, Suid.: neut. as Adv., ἡ ἀπώτερον (sc. γραμμή) Euc. 3.15, al.; opp. ἔγγιον, Id. Phaen. p.4 M.
farther off, S. OT 137, Ar. Nu. 771, Pl. Phdr. 254c, etc.; γένει ἀ. ὄντες D. 43.50: prov., ἀ. ἢ γόνυ κνάμα Theoc. 16.18.
farther from, Cratin. 229.
deaf, dub. in GDI 104 (Cypr.) (= Inscr.Cypr. 171 H.); λιταῖς ἄπωτε cj. in MoschioTrag. 2.
make pale, v.l. for ἀποχραίνω, Arist. Col. 796a24.

definition: ἄρα, Ep. ῥά (which is enclitic and used after monosyllables, ἦ, ὅς, γάρ, etc., or words ending in a vowel or diphthong, e.g. ἐπεί), before a consonant ἄρ (perh. cf. Lith. iȓ ‘andʼ): expressing consequence, then, or mere succession, there and then, and in many derived uses.

children.label: I
children.definition: there and then, straightway, ὣς φάτο βῆ δʼ ἄρʼ Ὄνειρος Il. 2.16: after a part., ὣς εἰπὼν κατʼ ἄρʼ ἕζετο 1.68, al.; πυθόμενος . . εἶπε ἄ. Hdt. 4.134, cf. 9.9; ἐρωτώσης τῆς μητρὸς ἀπεκρίνατο ἄρα X. Cyr. 1.3.2; with other Particles, δέ, ἦ, ὡς, etc., cf. ὁ δὲ Ἀστυάγης ἄ. εἶπεν ib. 4.10: also after Advbs. of Time, τότε δή ῥα, τῆμος ἄρα, etc.; οὕτως ἄρα Pl. Phdr. 259b; often in apodosi, as αὐτὰρ ἐπεὶ δὴ θηήσατο . . αὐτίκʼ ἄρʼ ἤλυθεν Od. 5.77; repeated τὼ μὲν ἄρʼ . . κεῖντο ἡ δʼ ἄρʼ . . ἀγόρευε Il. 21.426: in enumerations, e. g. in Homerʼs catalogue, then, next, οἱ δʼ ἄρʼ Ἀθήνας εἶχον 2.546; so in genealogies, Σίσυφος . . ὁ δʼ ἄ. Γλαῦκον τέκεθʼ υἱόν 6.154.

data.quote: ὣς φάτο βῆ δʼ ἄρʼ Ὄνειρος
αὐτὰρ ἐπεὶ δὴ θηήσατο . . αὐτίκʼ ἄρʼ ἤλυθεν
τὼ μὲν ἄρʼ . . κεῖντο ἡ δʼ ἄρʼ . . ἀγόρευε
Σίσυφος . . ὁ δʼ ἄ. Γλαῦκον τέκεθʼ υἱόν

children.definition: mark you! τὸν τρεῖς μὲν ἐπιρρήσσεσκον . . τῶν ἄλλων Ἀχιλεὺς δʼ ἄρʼ ἐπιρρήσσεσκε καὶ οἶος 24.456; with imper., ἀλλʼ ἄγε δὴ κατʼ ἄρʼ ἕζευ 24.522: to point a moral or general statement, φευγόντων δʼ οὔτʼ ἂρ κλέος ὄρνυται οὔτε τις ἀλκή 5.532.

data.quote: τὸν τρεῖς μὲν ἐπιρρήσσεσκον . . τῶν ἄλλων Ἀχιλεὺς δʼ ἄρʼ ἐπιρρήσσεσκε καὶ οἶος
ἀλλʼ ἄγε δὴ κατʼ ἄρʼ ἕζευ
φευγόντων δʼ οὔτʼ ἂρ κλέος ὄρνυται οὔτε τις ἀλκή

children.definition: antecedent and consequent, οἰνοχόει . . ἄσβεστος δʼ ἄρʼ ἐνῶρτο γέλως 1.599, cf. 24.507; τοὔνεκʼ ἄρʼ ἄλγεʼ ἔδωκε 1.96; freq. with οὕνεκα in protasi, 7.140, al.: also in questions, τίς τʼ ἄρ τῶν ὄχʼ ἄριστος ἔην; who then (say you) was . . ? 2.761: with demonstr. Pronoun in recapitulation, ἀλλʼ υἱὸν Πριάμοιο . . τόν ῥʼ Ὀδυσεὺς βάλε he it was, whom . . , 4.501: freq. in such phrases as ὣς ἄρα φωνήσας 2.35, al.; ὣς ἄρʼ ἔφη 1.584, al.; ἦ ῥα 3.355, al., thus, then he spoke.—This usage is universal in Greek.

data.quote: οἰνοχόει . . ἄσβεστος δʼ ἄρʼ ἐνῶρτο γέλως

children.definition: χωόμενον κατὰ θυμὸν ἐϋζώνοιο γυναικὸς τήν ῥα . . ἀπηύρων whom ( and for this cause he was angry) they had taken away, 1.429; εἰ μὴ ὑπερφίαλον ἔπος ἔκβαλε . . φῆ ῥʼ ἀέκητι θεῶν φυγέειν for he said, Od. 4.504: freq. with οὕνεκα; so with relatives, ἐκ δʼ ἔθορε κλῆρος ὃν ἄρʼ ἤθελον αὐτοί the very one which . . , Il. 7.182.

children.label: B
children.definition: οὖν) , ἄριστον ἄ. ἡ εὐδαιμονία Arist. EN 1099a24; δῆλον ἄ. Id. Pol. 1295b33; in pseudo-syllogistic conclusions, Id. SE 174b11, Rh. 1401a3, al.: esp. by way of informal inference, as it seems, οὐκ ἄ. σοί γε πατὴρ ἦν Πηλεύς Il. 16.33; οὐδʼ ἄ. πως ἦν ἐν πάντεσσʼ ἔργοισι δαήμονα φῶτα γενέσθαι 23.670; μάτην ἄρʼ, ὡς ἔοικεν, ἥκομεν S. El. 772; οὕτω κοινόν τι ἄ. χαρᾷ καὶ λύπῃ δάκρυά ἐστιν so true is it that . . , X. HG 7.1.32; πολὺ γὰρ ἀμείνων ἄ. ὁ τοῦ ἀδίκου ἢ ὁ τοῦ δικαίου βίος Pl. R. 358c; ἦν ἄ. πυρός γʼ ἕτερα . . θερμότερα Ar. Eq. 382; ὦ τλῆμον ἀρετή, λόγος ἄρʼ ἦσθα Trag.Adesp. 374; so in announcing the discovery or correction of an error, as οὐκ ἐννενοήκαμεν ὅτι εἰσὶν ἄ. . . Pl. R. 375d; φαίνεται πρὸ ποδῶν ἡμῖν κυλινδεῖσθαι καὶ οὐχ ἑωρῶμεν ἄρʼ αὐτό ib. 432d; εἰκότως ἄ. οὐκ ἐγίγνετο· ὡς γὰρ ἐγὼ νῦν πυνθάνομαι. . X. An. 2.2.3.

data.quote: οὐκ ἄ. σοί γε πατὴρ ἦν Πηλεύς
οὐδʼ ἄ. πως ἦν ἐν πάντεσσʼ ἔργοισι δαήμονα φῶτα γενέσθαι
πολὺ γὰρ ἀμείνων ἄ. ὁ τοῦ ἀδίκου ἢ ὁ τοῦ δικαίου βίος
ἦν ἄ. πυρός γʼ ἕτερα . . θερμότερα
ὦ τλῆμον ἀρετή, λόγος ἄρʼ ἦσθα

children.definition: τίς ἄ. ῥύσεται; who is there to save? A. Th. 92; so in exclamations to heighten the expression of emotion, οἵαν ἄρʼ ἥβην . . ἀπώλεσεν what a band of youth was that . . ! Id. Pers. 733; so ὡς ἄρα ib. 472, S. Fr. 577; τί μʼ ἄ. τί μʼ ὀλέκεις; Id. Ant. 1285; τί οὖν . . ἄ. X. Oec. 6.2; πῶς ἄ.; οὕτως ἄ., etc.; ἄ. alone, ἔζης ἄ. S. Fr. 686: esp. in ironical comments, Ar. Av. 476, 1371, etc.

data.quote: τί μʼ ἄ. τί μʼ ὀλέκεις;

children.definition: namely, ἐρῶ, ὡς ἄ. . . Pl. Tht. 152d, cf. 156e.
τοι ἄρα, τἄρα, v. sub τοι II.2.
εἰ (or ἐάν) μὴ ἄ. unless perhaps, Pl. Ap. 38b, D. 58.4; separated from εἰ μή, Id. 9.20; with irony, εἰ μὴ ἄ. ἡ τῆς ἀρετῆς ἐπιμέλεια διαφθορά ἐστιν X. Mem. 1.2.8.

data.quote: εἰ μὴ ἄ. ἡ τῆς ἀρετῆς ἐπιμέλεια διαφθορά ἐστιν

children.definition: ἢν ἄ. ποτὲ κατὰ γῆν βιασθῶσιν Th. 1.93, etc.; or simply, perhaps (sts. separated from εἰ) , εἴ τις οὖν ὑμῶν ἄ. . . ὑπελάμβανεν D. 21.8; εἴ τις ἰδίᾳ τινὰ δεδιὼς ἄ. ἀπρόθυμός ἐστιν Th. 4.86.

data.quote: ἢν ἄ. ποτὲ κατὰ γῆν βιασθῶσιν
εἴ τις οὖν ὑμῶν ἄ. . . ὑπελάμβανεν
εἴ τις ἰδίᾳ τινὰ δεδιὼς ἄ. ἀπρόθυμός ἐστιν

children.label: C
children.definition: τἄρα, μεντἄρα, οὐτἄρα: also δήξομἄρα for δήξομαι ἄ., Ar. Ach. 325; οἰμώξετἄρα, κλαύσἄρα, Id. Th. 248, Pax 532: also in Trag., E. Hyps.Fr. 34.86.

children.label: D
children.definition: ἄρα never stands first in the sentence in Classical Greek ( Arist. Mech. 851a22 is corrupt), but is found at the beginning of an apodosis in Ev.Matt. 12.28, Ep.Rom. 10.17, and first in a sentence, Ev.Luc. 11.48, Vett.Val. 305.20; in conclusion of syllogism, Herm. ap. Stob. 3.11.31.
anxiety or impatience, = Ep. and Lyr. ἦ ῥα:

D. 35.44 a negative answer is implied in the question ἆρʼ ἂν οἴεσθε . . ; but an affirmative in X. Cyr. 4.6.4 ἆ. βέβληκα δὶς ἐφεξῆς; cf. ἆρʼ εὐτυχεῖς . . ἢ δυστυχεῖς; E. Ph. 424.—To make it plainly neg., we have ἆ. μή . . ; A. Th. 208, Pl. Phd. 64c; and to make it plainly affirmative, ἆρʼ οὐ; ἆρʼ οὐχί; S. OC 791, OT 540; ἆρʼ οὐχ οὕτως; Pl. Phlb. 11d.
ἆ. οὖν; is used to draw an affirmative inference, Id. Grg. 477a, La. 190b; also when a neg. answer is expected, Id. Chrm. 159b; with a neg., ἆρʼ οὖν οὐ . . ; Id. Phdr. 263a, etc.
ἆρά γε, each Particle retains its force, γε serving to make the question more definite, Ar. Pl. 546, X. Mem. 1.5.4, etc.
τίς interrog., τίνος ποτʼ ἆρʼ ἔπραξε χειρί S. Aj. 905; τίδʼ ἆρʼ ἐγὼ σέ; E. IA 1228; τίς ἆρʼ ὁ φεύγων; Ar. V. 893; with ἤν, E. Rh. 118.
σκεψώμεθα τοῦτο ἆ . . . Pl. Phd. 70e, cf. R. 526c, al., Arist. Ph. 204b3, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: Archil. 86, 89, Pi. P. 4.78, Ar. V. 3; τοιοῖσδε χρησμοῖς ἆ. χρὴ πεποιθέναι; A. Ch. 297, cf. 435; τῷ δὲ ξιφήρης ἆρʼ ὑφειστήκει λόχος E. Andr. 1114: in exclamations, βραδεῖαν ἡμᾶς ἆρʼ ὁ τήνδε τὴν ὁδὸν πέμπων ἔπεμψεν S. Aj. 738; ὀδυνηρὸς ἆρʼ ὁ πλοῦτος E. Ph. 566, cf. El. 1229, Hipp. 1086; ἦ δεινὸν ἆρʼ ἦν Id. Fr. 931; ἔμελλόν σʼ ἆ. κινήσειν Ar. Nu. 1301, cf. Ach. 347.

data.quote: τῷ δὲ ξιφήρης ἆρʼ ὑφειστήκει λόχος
βραδεῖαν ἡμᾶς ἆρʼ ὁ τήνδε τὴν ὁδὸν πέμπων ἔπεμψεν

children.label: B
children.definition: ἆ. almost always stands first in the sentence, but cf. Pl. Grg. 467e; καὶ ὑπὲρ τούτων ἆ. . . Jul. Or. 2.61c: in Poetry greater licence is taken, v. supr. I.4, II.
prayer, Il. 15.378, 598, 23.199, Hes. Op. 726, Pi. I. 6(5).43; ἀρὴν ἐποιήσαντο παῖδα γενέσθαι Ἀρίστωνι offered prayers that a child should be born, Hdt. 6.63.
vow, Inscr.Cypr. 83, 147H.

curse, imprecation, ἐξ ἀρέων μητρὸς . . ἥ ῥα θεοῖσι πόλλʼ ἀχέουσʼ ἠρᾶτο Il. 9.566; freq. in Trag., mostly in pl., A. Pr. 910, S. OT 295; ἀρὰς ἀρᾶσθαι, προστιθέναι, ἐξανιέναι, E. Ph. 67, S. OC 952, 154 (lyr.), 1375; ἐπεύχεσθαι Pl. Criti. 119e; θέσθαι ἐπί τινας Plu. Cam. 13: also in sg., πατρὸς δʼ ἀ. κρανθήσεται A. Pr. 910, cf. Ag. 457 (lyr.), etc.; ἡ τοῦ νόμου ἀ. Pl. Lg. 871b; ἀρᾷ . . ἔνοχος ἔστω ib. 742b, etc.: in pl., imprecations, freq. in Inscrr. on those who shall mutilate or remove them, Inscr.Magn. 105.53 (ii B. C.), IG 3.1417 sqq.

data.quote: ἐξ ἀρέων μητρὸς . . ἥ ῥα θεοῖσι πόλλʼ ἀχέουσʼ ἠρᾶτο

children.label: II
children.definition: Ἀρά personified as the goddess of destruction and revenge, ὦ πότνιʼ Ἀρὰ σεμναί τε θεῶν παῖδες Ἐρινύες S. El. 111; δεινόπους Ἀρά Id. OT 418; but in A. Eu. 417 the Erinyes say that Ἀραί is their own name γῆς ὑπαί; Ἀρά τʼ Ἐρινὺς πατρὸς ἡ μεγασθενής Id. Th. 70; Ἀρᾶς ἱερόν Ar. Fr. 575. (Hence the Verb ἀράομαι.) [ Ep. always ᾱρ, Att. always ᾰρ.] (From ἀρϝᾱ, cf. κάταρϝος.)

data.quote: ὦ πότνιʼ Ἀρὰ σεμναί τε θεῶν παῖδες Ἐρινύες
γῆς ὑπαί; Ἀρά τʼ Ἐρινὺς πατρὸς ἡ μεγασθενής

children.definition: office of Ἀραβάρχης, BGU 665ii5 (i A. D.).
rattle, ring, Hom. (mostly in Il.), always of armour, δούπησεν δὲ πεσὼν ἀράβησε δὲ τεύχεʼ ἐπʼ αὐτῷ Il. 5.42, al.; of the teeth, gnash, Theoc. 22.126; ἀραβεῖ δʼ ἁ γνάθος Epich. 21.2.

data.quote: δούπησεν δὲ πεσὼν ἀράβησε δὲ τεύχεʼ ἐπʼ αὐτῷ

children.definition: gnash, grind, ὀδόντας Hes. Sc. 249, A.R. 2.281.

Arabia, Hdt. 2.8, etc. (also, = κόσμος γυναικός, Hsch.): poet. Ἀρραβία Theoc. 17.86:— Adj. Ἀράβιος, α, ον, Arabian, οἱ Ἀ. Hdt. 1.198, al.:—also Ἀραβικός, ή, όν, χάραγμα PGen. 29.8 (ii A. D.), Plu. Ant. 69, Hsch.:—later Ἄραβες (v. Ἄραψ):—pecul. fem. Ἀραβίς, ίδος, Them. Or. 34.56: Ἀράβισσα, St.Byz.
take part with the Arabs, Suid.
in Arabic, Eust. ad D.P. 954.

definition: ἀραβίδες αἱ μετὰ κονιορτοῦ πνοαί, Hsch.

children.definition: Dsc. (post 2.185).
gnashing or chattering of teeth, ἄ. δὲ διὰ στόμα γίγνετʼ ὀδόντων Il. 10.375, cf. Hes. Sc. 404, Hld. 5.3; prob. f.l. for ἄραδος in Plu. QConv. 2.654b.

data.quote: ἄ. δὲ διὰ στόμα γίγνετʼ ὀδόντων

children.definition: rattling, ringing, σάκεος Call. Del. 147. (Prob. onomatop.)
Arab archer, employed for police duty in Egypt, PAmh. 2.77.4 (ii A. D.), etc.
with a rattle, Luc. Lex. 5.
= sq., τυμπάνων ἄ. E. Cyc. 205.

children.label: II
children.definition: Sor. Fract. 10.

clashing, clattering, rattling, A. Th. 249; ἀ. πετρῶν crashing shower of stones, E. Ph. 1143; στέρνων ἀ. beating of the breast in grief, S. OC 1609; ἀ. χεροῖν Lyc. 940.—Rare in Prose, Hellanic. 167 (c) J.

definition: ἀραδήσει θορυβήσει, ταράξει, and ἀράδηται· κεκόνηται (prob. -κίν-) , συγκέχυται, Hsch.; cf. ἄραδος.

children.definition: not dishonestly done, AB 357, Suid. s.v. ἀκαπήλευτον. Adv. -τως, = sine fraude, Just. Edict. 7.7.

disturbance, τοῦ χρωτὸς ἄ. ποιεῖν Hp. Morb. 4.56; ἄ. ἐμποιεῖν Id. Acut. (Sp.)18 [was: 47]; also of foods, ἄ. ἔχειν Id. VM 15; ἔχον ἄ. κακόν Id. Acut. 10; palpitation of the heart, ἄ. κακός Nic. Th. 775: generally, ὁ ἐκ τῆς συνουσίας ἄ. καὶ παλμός prob. in Plu. QConv. 2.654b. (Prob. onomatop., like ἄραβος.)
snarl, growl, of dogs, Ael. NA 5.51, Poll. 5.86, Ph. 1.694 codd. (Onomatop., = make the sound ἀρα, ἀρρα.)

definition: ἀράη φιάλην, καὶ ἀράκτην, Hsch.; cf. ἀράκη, ἀρακτήρ.

children.definition: belly, v. ἀραιός.
Hsch. s.vv. ἀδράκις, ἀρβάκις.
with thin-set teeth, Arist. HA 501b23, cf. Pr. 963b20 (dub. l.).
with thin hair, Hsch. s.v. ψεδνή, cf. Moer. 421.
thinly porous, flaccid, Alex.Aphr. Pr. 1.2.

definition: ἀραῖος [ ᾰ], α, ον, also ος, ον S. Ant. 867 (lyr.): ( ἀρά):

children.label: I
children.definition: Pass., prayed to or entreated, Ζεὺς ἀ., = ἱκέσιος, S. Ph. 1182 (lyr.).
prayed against, accursed, γονά A. Ag. 1565 (lyr.); πότμος ἀ. ἐκ πατρός Id. Th. 898 (lyr.); μʼ ἀραῖον ἔλαβες you adjured me under a curse, S. OT 276.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., cursing, bringing mischief upon, c. dat., φθόγγος ἀ. οἴκοις A. Ag. 237 (lyr.); δόμοις ἀ. S. OT 1291, cf. E. Med. 608, IT 778; ἀ. γονεὺς ἐκγόνοις ὡς οὐδεὶς ἕτερος ἄλλος Pl. Lg. 931c: abs., A. Ag. 1398, S. Tr. 1202.—Almost confined to Trag., exc. Pl. l.c.

data.quote: ἀ. γονεὺς ἐκγόνοις ὡς οὐδεὶς ἕτερος ἄλλος

definition: ἀραιός [ ᾰ], ά, όν, ( ἁρ- Hdn.Gr. 2.108, v.l. in Il. 18.411, al.)

children.definition: thin, slender, κνῆμαι, χείρ, γλῶσσαι, Il. l.c., 5.425, 16.161; γαστήρ Nic. Th. 133; narrow, εἴσοδος Od. 10.90; of ships, Hes. Op. 809; φάλαγγες ἀ., opp. βαθύτεραι, X. Lac. 11.6, cf. Plu. Crass. 23; ἀραιᾷ τροφῇ χρῆσθαι meagre, of diet, Arist. Pol. 1335b13.

children.label: II
children.definition: of loose texture, opp. πυκνός, Anaximen. 1, Meliss. 7, Anaxag. 12,15, cf. Emp. 104 ( Sup.), Thphr. CP 2.4.7, etc.; opp. πίων, Arist. Pr. 880a38; freq. in Hp., as VM 22; δέρμα Aph. 5.71; ὀστέον Art. 33; εἴρια Mul. 1.1; ὁμίχλη . . νέφους ἀραιοτέρα Arist. Mu. 394a21, cf. Mete. 364b25 ( Comp.); σπόγγοι D.S. 3.14.

children.label: b
children.definition: φλύκταιναι ἀ. empty blisters, Nic. Th. 240 (v. Sch.ad loc.), cf. Theoc. 12.24.
in open order, opp. πυκνός, τὸ ἀραιότατον [διάστημα] Ascl. Tact. 4.1, etc.

children.label: III
children.definition: intermittent, πνεῦμα Hp. Epid. 1.4.1 [1.26.αʹ], .2 [βʹ]; ἆσθμα, βήξ, Aret. SD 1.11, etc. Adv. -ῶς Hp. Nat.Puer. 24; of the pulse, Gal. 9.444, al.

children.label: IV
children.definition: scanty, few and far between, τρίχες Arist. Col. 797b27; ἀκτῖνες ib. 791a27; φωναί Id. Aud. 803b28; ὀδόντες Poll. 2.94, etc.

children.label: V
children.definition: ἀραιά (sc. γαστήρ), ἡ, flank, belly, Ruf. Onom. 171.

children.label: VI
children.definition: thin, Theoc. 13.59. (Homeric metre proves ϝαραιός.)
with porous, spongy flesh, Hp. Nat.Puer. 21, Mul. 1.1, Hices. ap. Ath. 7.288c ( Comp.).
of thin warp, fine, Hsch. s.v. μανοστήμοις.
with columns widely spaced, Vitr. 3.31.
with loose tissues, Gal. 6.407.

looseness of substance, porousness, rarity, opp. πυκνότης, Hp. Aph. 5.63, al., Arist. Pr. 869b30: pl., Id. Ph. 260b10, Epicur. Ep. 2p.49U., Placit. 3.12.1; τῶν πόρων Arist. Aud. 802a24; opp. πύκνωσις, Plu. Fr.inc. 149.
with few pores, opp. πολύτρητος, Gal. UP 8.6 codd.
with few eyes or buds, κλῆμα Gp. 5.8.2.
with scanty leaves, Zonar. s.v. μανόφυλλον.
make porous, rarefy, τὴν ἐπιδερμίδα Hp. Nat.Puer. 20; τὴν σάρκα Id. Vict. 3.78; opp. πυκνόω, Arist. Pr. 884a27, Aret. CA 2.1, cf. SA 2.2, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., to be rarefied, Hp. Vict. 1.13, Arist. Mu. 394a36; ἀραιουμένων τῶν σωμάτων Ph. Bel. 71.43.
loose of substance, porous, Gal. 14.680.

interstice, crevice, chink, Str. 4.4.1, D.S. 1.39, Luc. VH 1.30, Placit. 3.3.11, Plu. Sollert. 2.980c, etc.; of the body, Hp. Morb. 4.45; pore, σώματος Hero Spir.I Praef. , al., cf. Sor. 1.115; a little bit, Longin. 10.17.
becoming or making porous, rarefaction, opp. πύκνωσις, dub. in Epicur. Nat. 14 Fr. 11 (cf. Fr. 6), cf. Plu. Strom. 3, D.L. 9.8 ( Heraclit.), Corn. ND 17, etc.
porosity, of the lungs, Hp. Oss. 13, etc.
mordanting, PHolm. 8.3.
of or for rarefying, ὑγρῶν, v.l. in Dsc. 1.62.
Hsch. s.v. ἀράη (leg. ἀράκην), and s.v. ἐξ ἀρκιάων (leg. ἀρακάων): so in Ath. 11.502b Αἰολεῖς τὴν φιάλην ἀράκην ( ἀρακίν cod.) καλοῦσιν.
of or from aracus, φόρος PFlor. 27.6 (iv/v A. D.).

definition: ἀράκιον [ ᾰκ], τό, = sq., POxy. 119.12 (ii/iii A. D.), Gal. 13.68.
ἀρακίς, ίδος, ἡ, and ἀρᾰκίσκος, ὁ, Dims. of ἄρακος, Gal. 19.85.
ἄρακος [ ᾰρ], ὁ, a leguminous plant,

children.definition: wild chickling, Lathyrus annuus, Ar. Fr. 412c, BGU 636.12 (i A. D.), Gal. 6.524.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἄ. τὸ τραχὺ καὶ σκληρόν, a variety which grew as a weed among lentils, Thphr. HP 8.8.3.

children.label: III
children.definition: ἱέραξ, Hsch.
aracus-seed, PRyl. 143.16 (i A. D.).
sown with aracus, BGU 1292.54 (i B. C.).
dry and fit for sowing aracus (sc. γῆ), CPHerm. 120r iii 5.
like ἄρακος: -ῶδες, τό, tine-tare, Lathyrus tuberosus, Thphr. HP 1.6.12.

definition: ἄραμα βόρβορος, Hsch. ἄραμεν· μένειν, and ἀράμεναι· ἡσυχάζειν, Id. (perh. for ἠρεμεῖν). ἀράμενοι· τὰ ἀπόχυτα ὕδατα, Id. ἄραμος· ἐρῳδιός, Id. ἀράνη· μεσάγκυλον, Id. (order requires ἀραύη). <ἄ>ρανις· ἔλαφος, Id. ἀράντισιν· ἐρινύσι (Maced.), Id.

children.definition: PMeyer 12.23 (ii A. D.), PTeb. 423.4 (iii A. D.), etc.

definition: ἀράξα, ἡ, fabulous plant which grows by the Araxes, Ps.-Plu. Fluv. 23.2.

children.definition: dashing, beating, Cass. Pr. 25.

children.label: II
children.definition: bread used in Athamania, Ath. 3.114b.
beaten with the hand, τύμπανα AP 6.94 ( Phil.).

definition: ἀράομαι, Aeol. inf. ἄρασθαι Sapph. Supp. 5.22: fut. ἀράσομαι [ᾱ], Ion. ἀρήσομαι: aor. ἠρησάμην, Aeol. 3 pl. ἀράσαντο Sapph. 51: pf. ἤρᾱμαι (only in compds. ἐπήραμαι, κατήραμαι): ( ἀρά): [ ᾱρ Hom., ᾰρ Lyr., Trag.]:—

children.definition: pray to a god, Ἀπόλλωνι Il. 1.35; δαίμοσιν 6.115: once c. acc., invoke, στυγερὰς ἀρήσετʼ Ἐρινῦς Od. 2.135.

inf., pray that . . , ἀρᾶται δὲ τάχιστα φανήμεναι Ἠῶ Il. 9.240; τὰ ἐναντία . . ἀρέομαι ὑμῖν γενέσθαι Hdt. 3.65 codd.; ἠρῶντο (sc. σφέας) ἐπικρατῆσαι prayed that they might prevail, 8.94; ἥ σε θεοῖς ἀρᾶται . . μολεῖν S. Aj. 509, cf. Ar. Th. 350.

children.label: b
children.definition: inf. only, πάντες κʼ ἀρησαίατʼ ἐλαφρότεροι πόδας εἶναι would pray to be, Od. 1.164.

children.label: c
children.definition: ἀρώμενος εἷος ἵκοιο praying till thou shouldʼst come, ib. 19.367.

pray for, ἔσλα τῷ γάμβρῳ Sapph. 51; ἀ. τινὶ ἀγαθά Hdt. 1.132: c. inf., σφᾦν . . θεοῖς ἀρῶμαι μή ποτʼ ἀντῆσαι κακῶν S. OC 1445; more freq. in bad sense, imprecate, τί τινι Id. OT 251; ἀρὰς ἀ. τινί Id. OC 952, And. 1.31, cf. A. Th. 633, Pr. 912; and without an acc., ἀρᾶσθαί τινι to curse one, E. Alc. 714, cf. S. OT 1291.

data.quote: σφᾦν . . θεοῖς ἀρῶμαι μή ποτʼ ἀντῆσαι κακῶν

children.definition: fut. inf., vow that . . , πατὴρ ἠρήσατο Πηλεὺς . . με . . σοί τε κόμην κερέειν ῥέξειν τε Il. 23.144.

data.quote: πατὴρ ἠρήσατο Πηλεὺς . . με . . σοί τε κόμην κερέειν ῥέξειν τε

children.label: II
children.definition: Act. only in Ep. aor. inf., ἀρήμεναι μέλλεις you are like to have prayed, Od. 22.322.

children.label: III
children.definition: part. ἀρημένος (q. v.) does not belong to this Verb.
Ammon. s.v. φωνεῖν.

definition: ἄραριν ἀράχνην, Hsch. ἀραρινοί (sc. λίθοι), stones used

children.definition: to fill chinks in walls, Id. ἄραρις· ἔνορκος, Id.

definition: ἀραρίσκω (redupl. form of √ αρ, join, fit together), only impf. ἀράρισκε Od. 14.23, Theoc. 25.103: the tenses in use (from *ἄρω) are mostly poet., v. infr.

children.label: A
children.definition: Ion. aor. 1 ἦρσα Il. 14.167 ( ἐπ-), Ep. ἄρσα Od. 21.45, imper. ἄρσον 2.289, pl. ἄρσετε A.R. 2.1062, part. ἄρσας Il. 1.136 (also inf. ἀράραι· ἁρμόσαι, πλέξαι, Hsch.): aor. 2 ἤρᾰρον, Ion. ἄρᾰρον, inf. ἀρᾰρεῖν, part. ἀρᾰρών (but ἄρᾰρον is used intr. in Il. 16.214, Od. 4.777, Simon. 41; while for ἄρηρεν, in trans. sense ( Od. 5.248), ἄρασσεν is the true reading; ἐς οὐρανὸν ἤραρεν ὄσσε Orph. A. 984 is by confusion with αἴρω:— Med., fut. ἄρσομαι Lyc. 995 acc. to Sch. (possibly fr. αἴρω): aor. 1 ἠρσάμην, part. ἀρσάμενος Hes. Sc. 320: 3 pl. aor. 2 opt. (in pass. sense) ἀραροίατο A.R. 1.369: pf. subj. ἀρήρεται Hes. Op. 431 ( προσ-):— Pass., pf. part. ἀρηρεμένος or -έμενος A.R. 3.833, al.; later incorrectly written ἀρηράμενος Q.S. 2.265, Opp. C. 2.384, etc.: aor. 1 ἤρθην, only 3 pl. ἄρθεν, for ἤρθησαν, Il. 16.211:—

join together, fasten, οἱ δʼ ἐπεὶ ἀλλήλους ἄραρον βόεσσι when they had knitted themselves one to another with their shields, Il. 12.105 (in Pass., μᾶλλον δὲ στίχες ἄρθεν 16.211); ἄγγεσιν ἄρσον ἅπαντα pack up, Od. 2.289.

children.label: II
children.definition: fit together, construct, ὅτε τοῖχον ἀνὴρ ἀράρῃ πυκινοῖσι λίθοισιν Il. 16.212:— Med., ἀρσάμενος παλάμῃσι Hes. Sc. 320.

data.quote: ὅτε τοῖχον ἀνὴρ ἀράρῃ πυκινοῖσι λίθοισιν

children.definition: μνηστῆρσιν θάνατον καὶ Κῆρʼ ἀραρόντες having prepared, contrived, Od. 16.169.

children.label: III
children.definition: fit, equip, furnish with a thing, νῆʼ ἄρσας ἐρέτῃσιν 1.280; καὶ πώμασιν ἄρσον ἅπαντας fit all [the jars] with covers, 2.353, cf. A.R. 2.1062; καὶ ἤραρε θυμὸν ἐδωδῇ furnished, i.e. satisfied, his heart with food, Od. 5.95:—in Pass., esp. pf. part., fitted, furnished with, πύλας ἀρηρεμένας σανίδεσσι A.R. 1.787.
please, gratify, ἐμέ γʼ ἁ στονόεσσʼ ἄρᾰρεν φρένας S. El. 147 (lyr.); ἁ Νεμέα ἄρᾱρε Nemea smiled on [him], Pi. N. 5.44.

data.quote: ἐμέ γʼ ἁ στονόεσσʼ ἄρᾰρεν φρένας

children.label: IV
children.definition: make fitting or pleasing, ἄρσαντες κατὰ θυμόν (sc. τὸ γέρας), Il. 1.136.

children.label: B
children.definition: pf. ἄρᾱρα with pres. sense, Ion. and Ep. ἄρηρα, part. ἀρᾱρώς, ἀρηρώς, Hom., Trag., and late Prose (except that X. has προσαραρέναι HG 4.7.6), Ep. fem. part. ἀρηρυῖα Hes. Th. 608, and metri gr. ἀρᾰρυῖα Hom., εὖ ἀρᾰρός Opp. H. 3.367: Ion. and Ep. plpf. ἀρήρειν or ἠρήρειν, with impf. sense, Il. 10.265, 12.56, etc.:— Med. only aor. 2 part. sync. ἄρμενος, η, ον, also ος, ον Hes. Op. 786 (cf. however ἀρηρεμένος): on aor. 2 used intr. v. supr. A. I:—

to be joined closely together, ἀρηρότες in close order, Il. 13.800; ἄραρον κόρυθές τε καὶ ἀσπίδες 16.214; ἑξείης ποτὶ τοῖχον ἀρηρότες [πίθοι] piled close against the wall, Od. 2.342: c. dat. instr., κόλλῃσιν ἀρηρότα Emp. 96.4; in Tactics, ἀραρός, τό, = ὀμφαλός (q. v.), Ascl. Tact. 2.6, etc.

to be fixed, φρεσὶν ᾗσιν ἀρηρώς Il. 10.553; θυμὸς ἀρηρώς Theoc. 25.113; ἄρᾱρε φέγγος shines for ever, Pi. N. 3.64; ἄραρεν ἥδε γʼ ὠλένη is fixed, A. Pr. 60: or metaph., θεῶν . . οὐκέτι πίστις ἄραρε E. Med. 414 (lyr.); ὡς ταῦτʼ ἄραρε ib. 322; τὸ σόν τʼ ἄραρε is fixed, ib. 745: abs., ἄραρε it is fixed, my mind is made up, Id. Or. 1330, Men. Epit. 185; τὸ ἀραρὸς ἦθος steadfastness, J. AJ 14.12.3; δόγματα ἀραρότα D.Chr. 12.56; also of persons, ἀραρὼς τὴν γνώμην steadfast, Plu. Dio 32; [ θεοὶ] ἀραρότες τοῖς κρίμασιν Hierocl. p.48 A.; τοῖς λογισμοῖς ἀ. Id. p.51 A.

children.label: II
children.definition: fit well or closely, ζωστὴρ ἀρηρώς a close-fitting belt, Il. 4.134; πύλαι εὖ, στιβαρῶς ἀραρυῖαι, 7.339, 12.454; σανίδες πυκινῶς ἀ. 21.535; fit or be fitted to a thing, ἔγχος παλάμηφιν ἀρήρει fitted the hands, Od. 17.4; κόρυθα κροτάφοις ἀραρυῖαν, κνημῖδες ἐπισφυρίοις ἀραρυῖαι, Il. 13.188, 19.370; κυνέη ἑκατὸν πολίων πρυλέεσσʼ ἀραρυῖα fitting a hundred champions, i.e. large enough for them, 5.744; also with Preps., κυνέη ἐπὶ κροτάφοις ἀραρυῖα Od. 18.378, Hes. Sc. 137; ὄφρʼ ἂν . . δούρατʼ ἐν ἁρμονίῃσιν ἀρήρῃ Od. 5.361; κεραυνὸς ἐν κράτει ἀ. fit emblem in victory, Pi. O. 10(11).83; ἀνθρώποισιν ἀρηρότα μυθίζεσθαι befitting men, Orph. A. 191.

data.quote: ὄφρʼ ἂν . . δούρατʼ ἐν ἁρμονίῃσιν ἀρήρῃ

children.label: III
children.definition: to be fitted, furnished with a thing, [ τάφρος] σκολόπεσσιν ὀξέσιν ἠρήρει Il. 12.56; πόλις πύργοις ἀραρυῖα 15.737; ζώνη θυσάνοις ἀραρυῖα 14.181: hence, furnished, endowed with, χαρίτεσσιν ἀραρώς Pi. I. 2.19; ἔθνεα θνητῶν παντοίαις ἰδέῃσιν ἀρηρότα Emp. 35.17; κάλλει ἀραρώς E. El. 948; πολλῇσιν ἐπωνυμίῃσιν ἀρηρώς D.P. 28.

children.label: IV
children.definition: to be fitting, agreeable, pleasing, (cf. ἀρέσκω) once in Hom., ἐνὶ φρεσὶν ἤραρεν ἡμῖν it fitted our temper well, Od. 4.777; ἄκοιτιν ἀρηρυῖαν πραπίδεσσι Hes. Th. 608.

children.label: V
children.definition: aor. 2 part. Med. ἄρμενος, η, ον ( ος, ον Id. Op. 786), fitting, fitted or suited to (cf. ἀρμένως), c. dat., ἱστὸν . . καὶ ἐπίκριον ἄρμενον αὐτῷ fitted or fastened to the mast, Od. 5.254 (cf. ἄρμενα, τά); τροχὸν ἄρμενον ἐν παλάμῃσιν Il. 18.600; πέλεκυν . . ἄ. ἐν π. Od. 5.234.
fit, meet, μάλα γάρ νύ οἱ ἄρμενα εἶπεν Hes. Sc. 116: rarely c. inf., ἡμέρα κούρῃσι γενέσθαι ἄρμενος a day meet for girls to be born, Id. Op. 786.

data.quote: μάλα γάρ νύ οἱ ἄρμενα εἶπεν

children.definition: prepared, ready, χρήματα δʼ εἰν οἴκῳ πάντʼ ἄ. ποιήσασθαι ib. 407; ἄ. πάντα παρεῖχον Id. Sc. 84, cf. Thgn. 275; ἄ. ἐς τόδε ἔργον A.R. 4.1461; ἄ. ἐς πόλεμόν τε καὶ ἐν νήεσσι μάχεσθαι Hermonax 1.3, cf. 8.

data.quote: ἄ. ἐς πόλεμόν τε καὶ ἐν νήεσσι μάχεσθαι

children.definition: agreeable, welcome, ἄρμενα πράξαις, = εὖ πράξας, Pi. O. 8.73; ἐν ἀρμένοις θυμὸν αὔξων Id. N. 3.58; so of men, ἄ. ξείνοισιν Pl. Epigr. 17 Diehl. (Cf. Lat. arma, armus, artus, Goth. arms, etc.)
compactly, closely, strongly, A. Supp. 945, E. Med. 1192, Pl. Phdr. 240d, D.Chr. 3.79, Iamb. Protr. 12: Comp. ἀραρότερον ( -ώτερον Dind.) Them. Or. 22.270c.
accursed, Suid.

definition: ἀράσσω, Att. ἀράττω [ᾰρ], Ion. and poet. impf. ἀράσσεσκον Pi. P. 4.226: fut. ἀράξω ( συν-) Hom., Dor. ἀραξῶ Theoc. 2.160: aor. ἤραξα ( ἀπ-) Hom., Ep. ἄραξα Hes. Sc. 461:— Pass., aor. ἠράχθην, Ep. ἀράχθην ( συν-) Hom.: fut. Med. in pass. sense, καταράξεσθαι Plu. Caes. 44:—

children.definition: smite, dash in pieces, ( Hom. only in compds. ἀπαράσσω, συναράσσω); of any violent impact, with collat. notion of rattling, clanging, as of horses, ὁπλαῖς ἀ. χθόνα Pi. l.c.; ἄρασσε (sc. πύλας) knock at the door, E. Hec. 1044; τὴν θύραν Ar. Ec. 978, cf. Theoc. 2.6 ( Pass., of the door, open with a crash, Luc. DMeretr. 15.2); pound in a mortar, ὅλμῳ ἀ. Nic. Th. 508; ἀράσσειν στέρνα, κρᾶτα, beat the breasts, the head, in mourning, A. Pers. 1054 (lyr.), E. Tr. 279 (lyr.); ἄρασσε μᾶλλον strike harder, A. Pr. 58; ὄψεις ἀράξας S. Ant. 52; ἤρασσε βλέφαρα Id. OT 1276:—in Pass., ὀμμάτων ἀραχθέντων Id. Ant. 975 (lyr.); also ἀ. πέτροις τινά strike with a shower of stones, E. IT 327:— Pass., πέτροισιν ἠράσσοντο A. Pers. 460:— ἀ. κιθάρην strike the lyre, Orph. A. 382; ὕμνον, μέλος, etc., Nonn. D. 1.15, 440, etc.
ἀράσσειν τινὰ ὀνείδεσι, κακοῖς, assail with reproaches or threats, S. Aj. 725, Ph. 374, cf. ἐξαράσσω.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., to be dashed against, πρὸς τὰς πέτρας Hdt. 6.44; πρὸς τὴν γῆν Luc. Anach. 11; of things, dash one against the other, A.R. 2.553, Ael. NA 16.39.—The simple Verb is poetic, used once by Hdt. and in late Prose, v. supr. (Akin to ῥάσσω, Ion. ῥήσσω (q.v.), cf. προσαρασσόμενον· προσρησσόμενον, Hsch.).

definition: ἀρασύνη πύελος, Hsch. ἀρασχάδες· τὰ περυσινὰ κλήματα, Id.

children.definition: shrine dedicated to Aratus, Paus. 2.9.4, Plu. Arat. 53:
kind of fig, Thphr. ap. Ath. 3.77a.

definition: ἀρατειχεύειν καταρᾶσθαι, οἱ δὲ στρατεύεσθαι, Hsch.

children.definition: of, for prayer or cursing: ἀρατικόν, τό, deprecation, as a form of proposition, Stoic. 2.60.

definition: ἀρατός, Ion. ἀρητός, ή, όν, ( ἀράομαι)

children.definition: prayed against, accursed, ἀρητὸς γόος Il. 17.37, 24.741; ἀρατὸν ἕλκος S. Ant. 972 (lyr.).

children.label: II
children.definition: prayed for, desirable, Sapph. Supp. 6.3; ἀ. καὶ σωτήριος γνώμη SIG 656.17 ( Abdera): hence Ἄρητος, Ἀρήτη, as pr.nn., the Prayed-for, Hom.: later Ἄρᾱτος. [ᾱρ Ep., ᾰρ Att.]
GDI 4992aii5 ( Gortyn).

definition: Ἀράτυος, ὁ (sc. μήν), name of month in Locris, SIG 2855.

children.definition: ground-pease, Lathyrus amphicarpos, Thphr. HP 1.1.7, 1.6.12.
of or belonging to a spider, νήματα AP 6.206 (Antip. Sid.); like a spiderʼs web, μίτος ib. 39 ( Arch.); ἀραχναίη, = ἀράχνη, ib. 9.233 ( Eryc.).
weave the spiderʼs web, Eust. 285.41.
A. Ag. 1492 (lyr.), cf. AP 11.110 ( Nicarch.); αἱ λειμώνιαι ἀ. Arist. HA 555b7 (elsewh. ἀράχνης, q.v.).

children.label: II
children.definition: spiderʼs web, Hp. Cord. 10, S. Fr. 286, AP 11.106 ( Lucill.).

children.label: III
children.definition: ἀ. λεπταί thin lines, Gal. UP 10.12.

children.label: V
children.definition: sundial, Vitr. 9.8.1.
spider, Hes. Op. 777, Pi. Fr. 296, A. Fr. 121, Call.Com. 2 [not found], Arist. HA 623a30, al.; ἀραχνᾶν ἱστοί B. Fr. 3.7.

children.label: II
children.definition: pulse, Hsch.
Hsch.
spiderʼs web, Od. 8.280, 16.35, Cratin. 190, Pherecr. 142, Pl.Com. 22, X. Mem. 3.11.6, Arist. HA 623a30.
disease in olive-trees, prob. due to the tent-caterpillar, Clisiocampa neustria, Thphr. HP 4.14.10, CP 5.10.2.

children.label: II
children.definition: Dim. of ἀράχνη, small spider, Arist. HA 555a27, 622b27. [ ᾰρᾱχν Hom., ᾰρᾰχν Com. ll.cc.]
spin a cobweb, Arist. HA 605b10:— Pass., to be covered with cobwebs, ib. 625a8:— Act. in same sense, Nonn. D. 38.14.

children.label: II
children.definition: form a venous network over, ἡ φλὲψ ἠραχνίωκε τοῦ σπληνὸς ἐναίμοισι φλεβίοισι Hp. Oss. 18.

data.quote: ἡ φλὲψ ἠραχνίωκε τοῦ σπληνὸς ἐναίμοισι φλεβίοισι

children.definition: like a cobweb, Hp. Dent. 24, Arist. HA 622b12.
filled with filaments, οὖρον Hp. Coac. 571; γάλα Arist. HA 583a34; ἀραχνιῶδες οὐρεῖν Dsc. 4.65.

like a cobweb, of the scum of urine, λιπαρότητες Hp. Prog. 12; also used of a feeble pulse, Gal. 19.411; of capillary veins, Id. 2.808; of nerves, ib. 400; ἀπόφυσις -εστάτη ib. 366; ἀ. χιτών in Medic., older name for the ἀμφιβληστροειδὴς χ. (q.v.), i.e. the retina, Herophil. ap. Cels. 7.7.13, Ruf. Onom. 153; but distinguished from it by Gal. 10.47.
A. Supp. 887.
spun as by spiders, i.e. fine-spun, ἀμπεχόναι Ph. 1.666, cf. 2.479, 637.
Arist. HA 554b28, Ael. NA 8.16.
wild vetch, Vicia Sibthorpii, Gal. 6.541.
Arab, Str. 1.2.34, J. BJ 1.19.4:—as Adj., Ἄραψ ἀτμός, of incense, Pae.Delph. 11; θώρηξ Nonn. D. 36.326: dat. pl. Ἀράβεσσι ib. 26.23.
plough, οὐδὲ τὰς ὁδὼς . . ἀρασόντι Tab.Heracl. 1.133. (Cf. Lat. arare.)
semicircular knife, used by cobblers, i.e. leather-workers ( ἄρβηλοι γὰρ τὰ δέρματα Hsch. s.v. ἀνάρβηλα), Nic. Th. 423.

children.label: II
children.definition: figure resembling it in shape, contained by three semicircles with coincident diameters [diagram in print version], Papp. 208.12.

definition: ἀρβίννη κρέας ( Sicel), Hsch.; cf. Lat. arvina.
ἀρβόν διεστός, ἀραιόν, ἐλαφρόν, Hsch. ἀρβύκη· τοῦ ὑποδήματος, Id.

children.definition: strong shoe coming up to the ankle, half-boot, used by country people, hunters, travellers, A. Ag. 944, Fr. 259, E. Or. 1470 (lyr.); πηλοπατίδες ἀ. Hp. Art. 62; αὐταῖσιν ἀρβύλαισιν ἁρμόσας πόδα with shoes and all, E. Hipp. 1189 (wrongly expld. by Eust. as = δίφρος, the stand of the charioteer), cf. Ba. 1134; cf. ἄρμυλα.
ἀρβύλη, ὀβελοί IG ΙΙ(2).158 A 6, al. ( Delos, iii B.C.).
Theoc. 7.26, APl. 16.306 ( Leon.).
with winged shoes, Lyc. 839.

definition: ἀργάδες εἶδος φυτοῦ, καὶ ἀργαὶ γυναῖκες, Hsch.

children.definition: one of the four Ionic tribes, in Attica and elsewh., E. Ion 1580, cf. Hdt. 5.66, CIG 3664 ( Cyzicus), etc.; also of a χιλιαστύς at Ephesus, SIG 353.10 (sg.).
to be white, E. Fr. 73, Philod.Scarph. 126 (prob.), Opp. C. 3.299:—in Pass., Nonn. D. 34.145 (s. v.l.).

definition: ἀργαλεῖον, τό, later form for ἐργαλεῖον (q.v.).

children.definition: painful, troublous, ἄνεμοι Il. 13.795; Ἔρις II.3; νοῦσος 13.667; Ἄσκρῃ, χεῖμα κακῇ, θέρει ἀργαλέῃ (trisyll.), οὐδέποτʼ ἐσθλῇ Hes. Op. 640; νύξ Alc. Supp. 12.11; difficult of attainment, ἀληθείη Emp. 114.2; κάθοδος Anacr. 43.5:—never in Trag., sts. in Com., ἀ. πρᾶγμα Ar. Pl. 1; στάσις Id. Th. 788; ἀργαλέας νύκτας ἄγειν Id. Lys. 764: rare in Prose, πρᾶγμα X. Hier. 6.4: Comp., Ph. 1.224: Sup., Id. 2.300.
troublesome, vexatious, Thgn. 1208 codd. ( ἁρπ- Bgk.); βιότοιο κέλευθοι Emp. 115.8, cf. Ar. Nu. 450, Men. 403.5: Sup., Ar. Eq. 978: rare in Prose, ἀ. τὴν ὄψιν Aeschin. 1.61.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἀργαλέον ἐστί, c. dat. et inf., ἀ. δέ μοί ἐστι διασκοπιᾶσθαι ἕκαστον Il. 17.252, cf. 12.410, Od. 13.312, etc.: rarely c. acc. et inf., ἀργαλέον δέ με πάντʼ ἀγορεῦσαι Il. 12.176; or without case, ἀ. δὲ πληκτίζεσθʼ ἀλόχοισι Διός 21.498, cf. Od. 7.241, etc.; also,

data.quote: ἀ. δέ μοί ἐστι διασκοπιᾶσθαι ἕκαστον

children.definition: ἀ. . . θεὸς βροτῷ ἀνδρὶ δαμῆναι God is hard to be subdued by mortal man, 4.397; ἀ. γὰρ Ὀλύμπιος ἀντιφέρεσθαι Il. 1.589.

children.label: III
children.definition: Adv. -ως AP 9.499. (By dissimilation from *ἀλγαλέος, cf. ἄλγος.)
grievousness, Ph. 1.346, Eust. 892.32.
commandant of a fort, IGRom. 3.1043,1044 ( Palmyra, iii A.D.) (Persian word).

definition: ἀργᾶς, Dor. contr. for ἀργάεις, v. ἀργήεις.

children.definition: of or from Argos, Argive: Ἀργεῖοι in Hom., like Ἀχαιοί, for the Greeks in general:— ἡ Ἀργεία (sc. γῆ) Argolis, Th. 2.27, al.; ἀργεῖαι, αἱ, womenʼs shoes, Hsch.; ἀργεῖος (sc. βόλος), ὁ, name of a throw at dice, Id.
Antim. 82.

definition: Ἀργειφόντης, ου, ὁ, voc. -φόντα h.Hom. 29.7, Orph. H. 28.3, Luc. Tim. 32: ( Ἄργος, Φόνος):—

children.definition: slayer of Argus, epith. of Hermes, Od. 1.38, al., Hes. Op. 77, etc.: variously expld. by Gramm., cf. Corn. ND 16.

children.label: II
children.definition: Paus.Gr. Fr. 65, from ἀργῆς, serpent-slayer, i.e. Apollo, S. Fr. 1024, cf. Sch. A. Pr. 569; of Telephus, Parth. Fr. 33.
son of Hermes, Pancrat. Oxy. 1085.9.
vapour bath (Maced.), Suid.
the legs and feet of a sheep-skin, and so generally, offal, Ar. V. 672.
albugo, a white speck on the eye, S. Fr. 233, Hp. Loc.Hom. 13, Thphr. HP 7.6.2, 9.9.5, Dsc. 2.78.2.

children.label: II
children.definition: = Lappa canaria, Geum urbanum Avens, Plin. HN 24.176:—also ἄργεμος, ὁ, = λεύκωμα, Poll. 2.65.
upper part of the finger-nail, ib. 146.
Papaver Argemone, wind-rose, Crateuas Fr. 9, Dsc. 2.177, Orib. 14.60.2, Gal. 11.835.
ἀ. ἑτέρα, = ἄργεμον II, Ps.- Dsc. 2.178; written argemonia by Plin. HN 25.102.
Plin. HN 26.92.
AP 15.35 ( Theoph.).

definition: ἀργεννός, ή, όν, Aeol. for ἀργός,

children.definition: white, in Hom. almost always of sheep, ἀργεννῇς ὀΐεσσι Il. 6.424, etc.; of woollen cloths, ἀργεννῇσι καλυψαμένη ὀθόνῃσι 3.141; later, ἀ. μόσχοι E. IA 574 (lyr.); κρίνη Chaerem. 8, cf. AP 9.384.11; ὀθόναι ib. 5.259 ( Paul.Sil.); σέλα ib. 9.46 (Antip. Thess.); γαῖα Opp. H. 1.795.
silvery, δελματικομαφόρτης POxy. 1273.12 (iii A.D.):— also ἀργέντιος, ib. 1310.
clearing, brightening, epith. of the south wind, Il. 11.306, 21.334.

children.label: II
children.definition: the north-west wind, ἀ. Ζέφυρος Hes. Th. 379, 870, cf. Acus. 15J.; Ἀργέστης, pr.n., Arist. Mete. 363b24, Thphr. Sign. 35, D.S. 1.39, Plu. Sert. 8, AP 9.42 ( Jul.).

children.label: III
children.definition: white, ἀργέσταο λίπευς ἰσόμοιρον ἐλαίου Nic. Th. 592.
ἀργέτις, ἡ, = ἀργήεσσα, Ἠώς Nonn. D. 16.124; voc. ἀργέτι AP 5.253 ( Paul.Sil.):—also nom. ἀργέτᾰ Μήνη Max. 587; ἀργέται ἵπποι Orac. ap. Phleg. Mir. 3.
Hsch.

definition: ἀργεφάντης, coined as etym. of ἀργειφόντης, Corn. ND 16.
ἀργέω, fut. -ήσω: aor. ἤργησα BGU 698.4 (ii A.D.): pf. ἤργηκα POxy. 1160.14 (iii/iv A.D.): ( ἀργός, ἀεργός):—

children.definition: to be unemployed, do nothing, Hp. Mochl. 23, E. Ph. 625, X. Cyr. 1.2.15, Pl. R. 426a, etc.; keep Sabbath, LXX 2 Ma. 5.25; ἀ. τὴν ἑβδόμην J. BJ 7.3.3; οἱ ἀργοῦντες the idle, Trag.Adesp. 527; γῆ ἀργοῦσα lying fallow, X. Cyr. 1.6.11, PFlor. 262.9 (iii A.D.); ἀργῆσαν ἤμυσε στέγος S. Fr. 864; φησὶν ἀργῆσαι τὸ ἐργαστήριον is out of work, D. 27.19; of the senses, to be at rest, νυκτὸς τῆς ὄψεως ἀργούσης Arist. Pr. 903a21, cf. Somn.Vig. 455a30: c. gen. rei, ἀργήσει . . τῆς αὑτοῦ δημιουργίας will be unoccupied in his own work, Pl. R. 371c.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., to be left undone, X. Cyr. 2.3.3; to be fruitless, ἡ σκέψις ἂν ἀργοῖτο Id. Hier. 9.9.

definition: ἀργεώτας, ὁ, title of Apollo in Messenia, Paus. 4.34.7.
ἀργήεις, εσσα, εν: Dor. ἀργάεις, contr. ἀργᾶς, gen. ᾶντος: (v. ἀργός):—

children.definition: white, shining, ταῦρον ἀργᾶντα Pi. O. 13.69; ἐν ἀργάεντι (v.l. ἀργινόεντι) μαστῷ Id. P. 4.8; οἰωνός . . ἔξοπιν ἀργᾶς, = πύγαργος, prob. in A. Ag. 115 (lyr.).

definition: ἀργής, ῆτος, ὁ, ἡ, Ep. dat. and acc. ἀργέτι, ἀργέτα (v. infr.), gen. ἀργέος Nic. Al. 305, and v.l. Th. 856:—

children.definition: bright, glancing, mostly of vivid lightning, κεραυνός Il. 8.133, Od. 5.128, al., Ar. Av. 1747; opp. ψολόεις κεραυνός, Arist. Mete. 371a20; Ζεὺς ἀργής, i.e. fire, Emp. 6.2; ἀργέτι αὐγῇ Id. 21.4; φύσις Orph. H. 10.10.

shining, white, of fat, ἀργέτι δημῷ Il. 11.818; ἀργέτα δημόν 21.127; of a robe, ἑανῷ ἀργῆτι φαεινῷ 3.419; ἀργῆτι μαλλῷ A. Eu. 45, cf. S. Tr. 675; ἀργὴς Κολωνός because of its chalky soil, Id. OC 670 (lyr.): neut., ἀργῆτος ἐλαίου Nic. Th. 105; ἀργῆτα κέλευθα Opp. C. 2.140.—Poet. word, cf. Arist. l.c.

definition: ἀργῆς, Dor. ἀργᾶς ( ἄργας AB 442), ὁ,

children.definition: serpent, Achae. 1, Trag.Adesp. 199; ὄφις ἀργῆς Hp. Epid. 5.86: also an obscure nickname of Demosthenes, Aeschin. 2.99, Plu. Dem. 4.
glancing, flashing, πτηνὸς ἀ. ὄφις, of an arrow, A. Eu. 181.
white, ἀφρός Id. Th. 60; κύκνοι Theoc. 25.131.

want of employment, πεσσοὺς κύβους τε, τερπνὸν ἀργίας ἄκος S. Fr. 479.4; νεύρων καὶ ἄρθρων Hp. Mochl. 23; τοῦ καλοῦ Hierocl. in CA 19p.461M.; ψυχῆς ἀργίη Democr. 212; idleness, laziness, E. HF 592; νόμος περὶ τῆς ἀργίας against those who would not work, D. 57.32; γραφὴ ἀργίας AB 310, cf. Plu. Sol. 17, 31: in pl., Isoc. 7.44.

data.quote: πεσσοὺς κύβους τε, τερπνὸν ἀργίας ἄκος

children.label: b
children.definition: quietism, E. Med. 296.
rest, leisure, τῶν οἰκείων ἔργων from . . , Pl. Lg. 761a (pl.), LXX Wi. 13.13, etc.
holidays, Arr. Epict. 4.8.33, = feriae or justitium, App. BC 1.56, PPetr. 3: sg., of the Sabbath, LXX Is. 1.14.
lapse of cultivation, Thphr. CP 4.5.6.
with white kine, of Euboea, Poet. ap. Ael. NA 12.36 ( ἀργίβοιος Lobeck).

definition: ἀργιβρέντας, ὁ, ( βρέμω, βροντή) = sq., Pi. (?) Oxy. 1792; cf. ἀναξιβρέντας.

children.definition: with bright, vivid lightning, epith. of Zeus, Il. 19.121, al., Orph. Fr. 21a, 168, Pi. O. 8.3, Cleanth.Stoic. 1.32.
white-horned, αἶγες Orac. ap. D.S. 7 Fr. 16.
θάκοις ἀ. καθήμενοι E. Fr. 795 codd. Stob.

definition: ἀργιλιπής, ές, Archil. 160:—and ἀργίλιψ, ιπος, Nic. Th. 213 (of serpents),

children.definition: white.
underground dwelling, so called in Magna Graecia, Ephor. 45, Eust.ad D.P. 1166; cf. ἄργελλα.

definition: ἀργίλληψιν γῆ μὴ βλαστάνουσά τι, Hsch.
ἄργιλλος or ἄργῑλος (so Ἐφ.Ἀρχ. 1893.31 (Acarn.)), ἡ, ( ἀργός A)

children.definition: white clay, potterʼs earth, Arist. Pr. 890a26, Thphr. CP 3.20.3, Opp. H. 4.658.

definition: ἀργιλλοφόρητος γῆ, dub. sens. in PTeb. 702.

children.definition: clayey, ἀργιλωδεστέρην γῆν Hdt. 2.12, cf. Arist. Mete. 352b10, Thphr. HP 3.18.5, Antyll. ap. Orib. 9.11.4; ὄχθαι Euph. 11 (= Archyt.Amph. 2).
Eust. ad D.P. 1166.
white-crested, κολώνα Pi. Fr. 200.
quick-witted, acc. to Hsch.) epith. of bull which carried Europa, Phryn.Trag. 16.
clouded with white, ὀπός S. Fr. 534.2 (anap.).

bright-shining, white, epith. of Lycastus and Camirus, from their lying on chalky hills, Il. 2.647, 656; νῆσοι Ἀργινοῦσαι X. HG 1.6.27; of milk, AP 7.23 ( Antip. Sid.); χαλινά A.R. 4.1607; μαστός, v.l. for ἀργάεις (q.v.), Pi. P. 4.8.
white-toothed, white-tusked, λευκοὶ ὀδόντες ἀργιόδοντος ὑός Il. 10.264, cf. Od. 8.60, etc.; κύνες Il. 11.292:—also ἀργῐ-όδων, A.R. 2.820.
Dsc. 4.134. ἀργιόπους· ἀετός (Maced.), Hsch. ἄργιος· λευκός, ταχύς, Id.
= sq., χίμαρος AP 6.299 ( Phan.).

definition: ἀργίπους, ὁ, ἡ, -πουν, τό, gen. ποδος,

children.definition: swift-footed, ἀργίποδας κύνας Il. 24.211; of rams, S. Aj. 237 (lyr.) ( = λευκόποδας, Sch.); = ἀετός (Maced.), Hsch.
διὰ τὴν ἀνάπαυσιν), Orph. Fr. 33.

definition: ἀργῖτις (sc. ἄμπελος), ιδος, ἡ, vine with

children.definition: white grapes, Verg. G. 2.99, Plin. HN 14.35, Isid. Etym. 17.5.23.

definition: ἄργμα, ατος, τό, ( ἄρχω) only in pl. ἄργματα,

children.definition: firstlings at a sacrifice or feast, Od. 14.446.
sedentary, Archig. ap. Aët. 13.120.
slow of dying, Sch. Opp. H. 1.142.
from Argos, S. Ant. 106 (lyr.), E. IT 70, Heracl. 775 (lyr.).
white-haired, Archim. Bov. 9.
serpent, Suid.; cf. ἀργῆς.

children.label: II
children.definition: v. Ἄργος·
take the part of the Argives, X. HG 4.8.34, Ephor. 137.
Argolis, Hdt., etc.
Adj., ὁ, ἡ, of Argolis, Argolic, ἐσθής A. Supp. 236:—later Ἀργολικός, ή, όν, Plu. Rom. 21. Adv. -κῶς Eust. 722.63.
in Argive fashion, S. Fr. 462.
with rough-hewn faces, λίθοι Ph. Bel. 82.5.
a sailor in the ship Argo, an Argonaut, Arist. Pol. 1284a23, etc.; Ἀπολλώνιος ὁ τοὺς Ἀργοναύτας ποιήσας Str. 14.2.13.
making idle, Plu. Num. 22.
slothful, Paul.Al. N. 4.

Ἄ. Ἀχαιϊκόν Il. 9.141; Ἄ. Πελασγικόν 2.681, etc.; ἄργος = πεδίον acc. to Str. 8.6.9, cf. Dionys. Epic. ap. St.Byz. s.v. Δώτιον, Call. Fr. 45:—hence Adjs. Ἀργεῖος, Ἀργολίς, Ἀργολικός, qq.v.: Ἀργόλας, ὁ, E. Rh. 41 (lyr.), Ar. Fr. 298.

shining, glistening, of a goose, Od. 15.161; of a sleek, well-fed ox, Il. 23.30; in Hom. mostly in the phrase πόδας ἀργοί, of hounds, swift-footed, because all swift motion causes a kind of glancing or flickering light, 18.578, Od. 2.11, etc.; κύνες ἀργοί Il. 1.50, 18.283, cf. D.S. 4.41, Corn. ND 16.
white, Arist. Top. 149a7.

children.label: II
children.definition: Ἄργος, ὁ, name of a dog, Swift-foot, Od. 17.292: also of the herdsman Argus ( i.e. bright-eyed, A. Pr. 567 (lyr.), Supp. 305) who was so called from his eyes being ever open and bright. (By dissimilation from *ἀργρός, cf. Skt. ṛjrá-, = (1) shining, (2) swift, Vedic pr. n. Ṛji-śvan-, lit. = possessing κύνες ἀργοί.)

definition: ἀργός (B), όν, later ή, όν Arist. EN 1167a11, Mete. 352a13, Thphr. Lap. 27, Ath.Mech. 12.11, etc.: ( contr. from ἀεργός):—prop.

children.definition: not working the ground, Hdt. 5.6; idle, lazy, opp. ἐργάτις, S. Ph. 97, cf. Ar. Nu. 53, etc.; γαστέρες ἀ. Epimenid. 1; ἀ. ἐπιθυμίαι Pl. R. 572e; ἀ. τὴν διάνοιαν ib. 458a; τὸ πρὸς ἅπαν ξυνετὸν ἐπὶ πᾶν ἀ. Th. 3.82; ἂν ἀ. ᾖ if he have no trade, Antiph. 123.3; πότερον ἀνθρώπου οὐδέν ἐστιν [ἔργον] ἀλλʼ ἀργὸν πέφυκεν; Arist. EN 1097b30: c. gen. rei, idle at a thing, free from it, τῶν οἴκοθεν from domestic toils, E. IA 1000; πόνων σφοδρῶν Pl. Lg. 835d; γυναῖκας ἀργοὺς ταλασίας ib. 806a; ἀ. αἰσχρῶν slow to evil, A. Th. 411; ἀργότεραι ἐς τὸ δρᾶν τι Th. 7.67; ἀ. περί τι Pl. Lg. 966d.

data.quote: τὸ πρὸς ἅπαν ξυνετὸν ἐπὶ πᾶν ἀ.
πότερον ἀνθρώπου οὐδέν ἐστιν [ἔργον] ἀλλʼ ἀργὸν πέφυκεν;

children.definition: δόρυ E. Ph. 1387; of money, lying idle, yielding no return, opp. ἐνεργός, D. 27.7 and 20; of land, lying fallow, Isoc. 4.132, X. Cyr. 3.2.19, Thphr. HP 9.12.2; opp. πεφυτευμένος, IG 7.2226 B ( Thisbe, iii A.D.); διατριβὴ ἀ. in which nothing is done, fruitless, Ar. Ra. 1498 (lyr.), Isoc. 4.44; χρόνον ἀργὸν διάγειν Plu. Cor. 31. Adv. ἀργῶς, ἐπιμέλεσθαι X. Mem. 2.4.7; ἔχειν D. 6.3: Comp. and Sup. ἀργότερον, -ότατα, X. Oec. 15.6 and 1.

children.label: b
children.definition: ἀ. λόγος, name of a sophism, Chrysipp.Stoic. 2.277, cf. Plu. Fat. 2.574e.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., unwrought, ἁρμός, κυμάτιον, IG 1.322b23,59; πυροὶ ἀ. unprepared for eating, Hp. VM 13; ἄργυρος Paus. 3.12.3; βύρσαι undressed hides, Ath.Mech. l.c.; unpolished, Thphr. Lap. 27.
not done, left undone, κοὐκ ἦν ἔτʼ οὐδὲν ἀ. S. OC 1605; ἓν δʼ ἐστὶν ἡμῖν ἀ. E. Ph. 766; οὐκ ἐν ἀργοῖς not among things neglected, S. OT 287; τὰ μὲν προβέβηκεν ἀμήχανόν ἐστι γενέσθαι ἀργά Thgn. 584.

data.quote: τὰ μὲν προβέβηκεν ἀμήχανόν ἐστι γενέσθαι ἀργά

children.definition: unattempted, μάχη Pl. Euthd. 272a.
τόπος ἀ., name of the 8th of the 12 ‘houses’, Ptol. Tetr. 128, Paul.Al. M. 4; πλανήτης Plot. 2.3.3; ζῴδιον S.E. M. 5.15.
silver-quinsy, which Demosthenes was said to have, when he abstained from speaking on the plea of quinsy, but really because he was bribed, Demad. Fr. 5 S., Plu. Dem. 25.
of or for a money-changer: ἡ-κή (sc. τέχνη), Poll. 7.170; personified, Luc. Bis Acc. 13, 24. Adv. -κῶς Id. Hist.Conscr. 10.
money-changer, banker, Pl. Plt. 289e, Theoc. 12.37, etc.: as Adj., ἀ. τιμή Maiist. 32.
‘silver-man’, symbol in alchemy, Zos.Alch. p.112B.
the silver-shielded, a corps in the army of Alexander, D.S. 17.57, Arr. An. 7.11.3, Ath. 12.539e, etc.; also in the armies of the Diadochi, Plb. 5.79.4, etc.

definition: ἀργυράφιον [ ᾱ], τό, Dim. of ἄργυρος, Theognost. Can. 126.34, AB 1339.

children.definition: silver-mines, Th. 2.55, 6.91; τὰ ἀ. ἔργα X. Vect. 4.5; τὰ ἔργα τὰ ἀ. D. 21.167; τὰ ἀ. alone, X. Mem. 2.5.2, Aeschin. 1.101, Pl. Lg. 742d.
overlaid with silver, κύλικες IG ΙΙ(2).161 B 79 ( Delos, iii B.C.).

definition: ἀργύρεος [ ῠ], α, ον, contr. ἀργῠροῦς, ᾶ, οῦν:

children.definition: of silver, of the bow of Apollo, Il. 1.49, cf. Pi. O. 9.32; κρήτηρ Il. 23.741, Od. 4.615, cf. A. Fr. 184; τάλαρον Od. 4.125; λάρναξ Il. 18.412; ἀσάμινθοι Od. 4.128, etc.; γένος Hes. Op. 144, etc.; ἀ. πλοῦτος Pl. Lg. 801d.
silver-plated, κλῖναι Hdt. 9.82.

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst., ἀργυροῦς, ὁ, silver coin, LXX Za. 11.12, al., SIG 731.20 ( Tomi, i B. C.), Hero Mens. 60.1, al.
silversmithʼs art, Eustr. in EN 296.10.
dig for silver, D.S. 5.36, Str. 3.2.9.
silversmith, Hsch.
of wrought silver, A. Fr. 185; φιάλαι E. Ion 1181; bearing silver, πρὼν [Παγγαίου] A. Fr. 25A.
Alciphr. 3.38) in a contemptuous sense, Ar. Pl. 147, Fr. 547, Eup. 113; ἀ. καὶ χρυσίδιον τὸν πλοῦτον ἀποκαλοῦντες Isoc. 13.4, cf. Socr. Ep. 36, Olymp. in Grg. p.275J.

data.quote: ἀ. καὶ χρυσίδιον τὸν πλοῦτον ἀποκαλοῦντες

children.definition: get or extort money, πάντοθεν Din. 1.40, cf. OGI 669.52 ( Egypt, i A.D.); ἀργυρισάμενοι for a bribe, Sammelb. 4416.19 (ii A.D.); τινά from one, J. AJ 14.14.6.

of, for, or in money: φόρος cash rental, AJA 16.13 ( Sardes, iv B.C.); ἀργυρικά, τά, taxes paid in money, ἀργυρικῶν πράκτωρ, πρακτορεία, BGU 15 i 13 (ii A.D.), PLond. 2.306 (ii A.D.); ζημίαι ἀ.
